review_body: This was an amazing hotel, would definitely class as five star and for a very affordable price. Staff were very friendly and welcoming, especially the two receptionists who deals with us - which you don't always receive as a young couple. Would definitely stay here again and highly recommend.

The Hotel The Celestine Tokyo Shiba is in a quiet, non-touristy part of Tokyo, which could be appealing. Mita subway and Tamachi rail stations are less than 10 minutes away, which is quite convenient, and around them are numerous eateries and small shops. It's a good establishment, but you should reserve a bigger room. Check-in was pretty easy and quick when I arrived at night. No problems with communication. The hotel's lobby and ambience are quite pleasant. Unfortunately I found my room small and cramped. It almost felt like one of those cheap Japanese business hotels. Overall I found it difficult to relax in the room. Once I opened my luggage, the room felt even smaller. There's also no real space to work on a laptop. At least everything seemed clean. The bed was ok and big enough. I appreciated the free bottled water. The TV had some foreign channels which was good. The free coffee in the room was quite yummy. Wifi was OK. Housekeeping seemed capable. The bathroom was not very large either. At least everything seemed clean and the shower gel, etc, were good products. There was no fan in there, which was kind of unusual. There is an interesting "relaxation" lounge on 1 of the floors. It has some interesting books and magazines, although unfortunately it doesn't always stay quiet, which can hinder the relaxation. If you need to go to the airport, the hotel can arrange a limousine bus, which is quite convenient. Be aware that it stops at other hotels after it picks you up, and so takes about 2 or more hours. Check-out on the last day was pretty easy. They stored my bags for a few hours while I had to go back out for some work, which was nice. Overall, the hotel is in a nice neighborhood and the staff is friendly, but if you stay here, make sure you book a larger room.

Stayed here for five nights on my trip to Tokyo. I enjoyed my stay here. The bedroom was comfortable and well equipped in terms of amenities. Compact by western standards but not particularly small for Japanese standards. I had a superior double room on the the top (17th) floor and the view from the large window in the room was nothing short of stunning. I even had a clear view of Mount Fuji on a couple of mornings when weather conditions were favorable. What more could you ask for. Breakfast was included for me and this was also great. Japanese or western breakfast options were available. The service provided was basically faultless. Everyone I came into contact with was courteous and efficient. It is worth mentioning that The Celestine is situated in a quiet area of central Tokyo. If you are looking for a buzz outside your hotel then look elsewhere. That said the Shiba area of Minato is quite upmarket so it is a nice area to stay in and walk about. Mita metro station is only a two minute walk away so you can access other areas of Tokyo quite quickly and efficiently using the excellent Tokyo metro system. Overall I thought The Celestine Shiba was excellent. Would be happy to use this hotel again.

What I liked the most about this hotel was the lounge. Really comfortable and great space to get some work done, read, and just chill. There are 2 convenience stores very close by and metro station is just 1.2 minute walk. Overall great experience.

The best 4-star hotel I've ever stayed in. Faultlessly clean and comfortable; well-presented and in excellent repair. Staff polite and efficient. Located close to several subway/railway stations. The lobby area is very attractive and the bar does good cocktails. Breakfast decent with a good range of tasty options, in a nice high-ceilinged room with lots of glass. Considering its moderately central location in a capital city, it was excellent value for money.

We stayed here for 3 nights and enjoyed every aspect - from the room, to the service and the amazing breakfast buffet. We emailed the hotel through their website and they kindly were able to check us in very early at around 10am which we really appreciated. The staff are friendly and the hotel is spotlessly clean. It was easy to get anywhere we wanted with several stations in walking distance. The bed was a bit firm but fine for us. We hope to return!

Back to Celestine for the fourth time, and once again, a good experience. I really like the style and aesthetics of the hotel, the rooms are tasteful, and the view is great. The location is also excellent, a few minutes’ walk from Mita (subway) and Tamachi (JR) station, in a less bustling business area but with lots of food options around. I would definitely be happy to come back but there are some small downsides. The superior double is a nice room but it’s quite small for two people with two large suitcases. It’s also a bit odd that there is no ventilation in the bathroom but a heated area of the mirror compensates somewhat. I booked breakfast for the first time, and the selection was adequate and good quality but not extensive, at least for Western dishes. I got a good deal where breakfast was nearly free but I wouldn’t pay full price for it. As in the last few years, the English level of the front desk staff was very limited, good enough for routine tasks but not much beyond that. On balance, a nice hotel offering good value.

Upon entering the lobby, you know this is an expensive place to stay. The staff are friendly and they will attend to your needs. The place is very clean and the rooms are so comfortable. If it had not been needed to go out and explore Tokyo, we'd be happy to just stay in the rooms and watch TV. The location is also good since we were able to go through the alleys and side streets where there are good hole-in-the-wall restaurants.The only negative comment I have is that their breakfast spread is the same everyday. But nevertheless, the food is delicious.

My partner and I spent two nights at The Celestine Tokyo Shiba for our first two nights in Japan. This hotel was excellent. As other reviewers have commented, it has a 5 star feel. The hotel is stylish and beautifully appointed. The staff are all exceptionally nice and helpful. Our room, while smaller than what we’re used to (by North American standards), it was comfortable and well designed (good lighting, good use of space, ample plugs, etc). We enjoyed the 24-hr lounge with tea, coffee, cookies. It was a large, comfortable space and it was nice to have access to an outdoor seating area. The fitness room wasn’t large but it had a few standard pieces of equipment in good working order. The hotel is well located. It’s in a quiet area close to transit and reasonable walking distance to Roppongi, Ginza and about an hour walk from Shibuya crossing. The hotel was also reasonably priced. We’ll definitely stay at this hotel and hotel brand in the future!

Getting there would have been easier taking the Metro direct from Haneda to Mita Station but its a nice location. The Hotel is beautifully presented, spotlessly clean and has a lovely luxury feel to it. the room was quite large, very comfortable and had everything we needed, in fact you really only need to bring your own clothes a full range of toiletries and nightwear is provided.We didnt use the restaurant and bar as we were out, did look a bit pricey but it is a business rather than tourist hotel, but there is a comfortable guest lounge you can use and we were able to avail ourselves of it before our room was ready.Would happily stay here again.

nice rooms, great location, smart but expensive bar, slightly unfriendly staff (wouldn't let us check in 10 mins early) but good hotel with views over the city. Airport bus takes you straight outside which is helpful

I will preface this to say that this is my forth different hotel this year in Japan and still searching for that winner. The staff were welcoming in typical Japanese style and custom. The bar menu was very limited. The room was typical for Japanese hotels (small but utilitarian). Ample counter space but no desk space to work. Lots of bathroom amenities and the standard heated toilet seat. Remember to get a spare key to keep the room AC on or your room will be quite warm when you return from a day out. My irks with the experience: typical low bed and this one had a serious mattress issue (big depression). There was a left over slipper and lip balm under the bed (who knows how long it was there) and one of the glasses in the bathroom had been used and not replaced (although turned over to indicate is was “clean” to use). Luckily I always travel with a few small paper bathroom size Dixie cups.

Arriving at Narita Airport I found the most hassle free route to the hotel was the Keisei Access Line which was direct from the terminal to Mita Station - from here it was a simple three minute walk up a quiet road (on a Sunday) to the door of the hotel. I arrived around 1:30pm and unfortunately there was no room available for me but the hotel held the bags while I went for a little wander. The lobby area was bright and spacious, complete with a bar and cafe. There was plenty of seating available (not just in the cafe) and the staff at reception were friendly and totally fluent in English. Other than the inability to check in early first impressions were certainly positive.Once I returned to the hotel it took just a few moments to complete the check in process and the lady behind reception explained the facilities of the hotel. It was great that my luggage had already been taken to the room and the three super fast lifts had me quickly there myself. In fact, throughout the stay, despite the hotel being apparently full there was never a need to wait more than a few seconds to be served by a lift which was great.My Superior Double room was on the 16th floor with brilliant views over the East of the city. As is a general trend for the city I’d been prepared for a small room but was pleasantly surprised with the space available. Both sides of the bed were easily accessible, there was loads of storage including a large wardrobe in the entrance area, plus a built in sofa in front of the window, giving a great place to admire the view and lights at night. The decor was clean and modern with units at both sides of the bed, complete with electric sockets and lamp. Each side also had controls for the lighting throughout the rest of the room. The mini bar was well stocked and there was a fantastic glass-fronted cabinet with other drink options, snacks and glasses, illuminated beautifully. The air-conditioning was effective and not too loud. The TV was a good size for the room but lacked any UK channels with CNN being the only English language channel.The bathroom was the disappointing aspect of the room, only because it wasn’t quite up to the same modern feel as everywhere else. The white fittings and taps / shower felt rather dated but fortunately was clean still. Everything worked well though, with the shower coming hot instantly and good power, the bath filled up quickly and was comfortable and, of course, the digital functions on the toilet was extensive. There were plenty of toiletries in small bottles provided as well as a bar of soap. The towels, although plentiful, were a little harsh and felt old, not as ‘fluffy’ as they perhaps should have been.Within the room there was every amenity imaginable provided. International adaptors for the electric sockets, pyjamas, slippers, gowns, stationary, full guide to the hotel services (although a bit more detail regarding dining options would have been good), plus the bathroom had every toiletry, toothbrush, shaving equipment, hairdryer etc - I couldn’t think of anything that I’d need which was missing!Sleep quality was incredible and there was absolutely no noise from the corridors or outside either. The lighting in the room was really cosy and suitable for all moods, including a night light which was wonderful. Housekeeping always observed the ‘do not disturb’ light, leaving a note if the room was missed. However I found they always proactively came back later in the day rather than having to request the visit from reception, like the note said. They always did a thorough job, leaving another two bottles of complimentary water each time.There was a residents lounge on the 14th floor which provided a nice retreat. With sofas and armchairs inside, as well as tables and chairs in an open courtyard it was an escape from the bustle of the rest of the city and hotel. It is open 24x7 and offers free tea / coffee, plus alcoholic drinks for a charge. It was a shame that there were no snacks available, but small plates could be ordered from the member of staff on duty. A TV showing some world news would have been a nice addition, plus maybe some quiet background music to add some atmosphere, but otherwise it was a nice facility to have available.The bar and cafe in the lobby area was nice, offering lunch time deals as well as smaller meals in the evening. Decor was nice, tables were large and everything was clean. Food was served quickly although the prices of drinks were a little on the high side, possibly to be expected given the location. I noted that the guides in the room stated that room service wasn’t available 24x7 so it was nice that the ground floor continued serving until late in the evening.Overall it was a fantastic base for a few days in the city. The location was quiet but easily walkable to many of the main sights, with transport connections almost on the doorstep. All of the staff throughout could speak great English and it was pleasantly modern. To be honest it could have passed for a five-star hotel and had it had a proper pool and proper bar would probably obtain it easily. I can highly recommend staying here and will certainly consider it when I’m in the city again.

Located in Shiba, I’ve found my new favourite hotel in Tokyo!We arrived around 8.00pm from Tokyo Station, after a 2.5 hours on the Shinkansen from Shin-Osaka Station. We were greeted warmly at reception and was informed that our luggage was waiting in our room, after using the hands free travel service.Our room was huge, clean, air conditioned and had a separate shower from a deep bathtub. We opted for just a room, without breakfast, which was just perfect. Wireless internet is included, but can be slow at times.The service is friendly, courteous, prompt and professional. Everything you need to make your stay that extra bit luxurious is found here! There is an amazing arrange of amenities for the shower/ bath: L’Occitaine products. Use the bath salts and soak in the bathtub, after a long day exploring Tokyo!Minibar is stocked, with a daily complimentary bottle of water/ day.Our room is super quiet, and the beds are just perfect for a good night’s sleep: not too hard, not too soft, not too small, bed linens extra soft and we have two pillows each.The views from our window - just beautiful! At night, Tokyo towershines brightly.There’s a bar in the lobby - must try the Shiba Sake, as well as a Spa and Gym on 14th floor.Airport Limousine Shuttle Bus services are available for an extra charge from here. Speak to reception who are always helpful.After two weeks travelling around the main cities in Honshu, we are so glad that we finished our last two nights here. To the staff and management of the Celestine Hotel, doomo arigatoo gozaimasu, for making our stay one of the best experiences!

Stayed here again and nothing changed. The only English speaking channel on TV is CNN. E paper for Wall Street Journal provided but you need to be ale to read Japanese when you enter the WS page. Wifi sucks. This time no earthquake but on last trip we were woken up by a shaking building. Ver scary. Lots of announcements over the speaker but .... only in Japanese. You have no idea what to do and how bad it is. On the positive side: Rooms are clean and breakfast is good . if you enjoy the local touch and don’t care if the hotel at least tries to make it easier for foreigners then you should stay here.. I will not return until this improves.

I am checking out in about 20 minutes after a 5 night stay here. The rooms are tiny. The staff is rude. I wanted to check out 1 hour after checkout time they want to charge for this. overall a horrible experience

We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights this month. It was certainly the best of all the hotels we stayed at in Japan. The location is in a business area but a quick train ride to the heart of Tokyo. Check in was efficient and all the staff spoke English, which was fantastic. They room was too small for me but had all the necessities. The lounge on the 14th floor and the outside areas were great for an evening drink. The lounge in the foyer was also a welcome addition for a nightcap or bite to eat. Reasonably priced....a good option in Tokyo.

We stayed at the Celestine Hotel for 3 nights on August 13th! Our check in was fast and efficient and the staff greeted us and helped with our luggage! Our room was the Queen room with a view, so beautiful and big! We had the buffet breakfast which was delicious with different options to choose from! Our room was cleaned daily and each staff member we walked by greeted us with a smile! Definately an amazing hotel with amazing staff! Will recommend to family and friends visiting Tokyo! Thank you Celestine for making our stay memorable!

We stayed at the hotel in July 2019 as part of our vacation trip around Asia with our 3 daughters. We had the only 3 bed bedroom in the hotel which had a double aspect window with great views. The staff are very friendly and helpful and we would definitely recommend the hotel for families and couples.

This is the 2nd time I stayed at this hotel, and it was as excellent as the first. What made this hotel special is the attentive service, the in room amenities, the bigger than average size room...and very high quality breakfast with good selection.Also, the airport limo bus stops at this hotel which makes it very convenient.

Just spent the weekend at The Celestine and cannot fault the hotel. Staff were excellent, rooms supplied absolutely everything required and location was great. We stayed on the 14th floor which also has the hospitality area for complimentary refreshments and the gardens. Our room was 1447 and on clear mornings gave a view of Mt. Fuji. I would definitely recommend the hotel.

Great location - near two tube(subway) stations, near bus stops (to Roppongi etc). There are super markets, convenient stores nearby. Clean room , great service . Very nice lounge on the 14th floor where you can have juice/ coffee for free (there is terrace outside too). you can take trains to Haneda airport from Mita-station, though I too taxi as I had two big suitscases. Apparently there is airport shuttle bus earlier in the day (my flight was late at night).

We loved the location, our room, the lounge. Everything was nice, clean and quiet. A very good starting position for every trip to innercity areas of Tokyo. We did not want to leave and can recommend this place to every visitor of Tokyo.

I stayed here for a work trip and it was great. Good location between 2 train stations made getting around easy. Hotel is modern, comfortable and quiet. Lots of delicious food within walking distance.

We gambled that spending a little more than we'd like for this hotel would be worth it, and the gamble turned out well for us. I want to share our experience since we were trying to be careful about expenses beyond the cost of the room. We were 2 family members who got a 'superior twin' room, which includes a small sofa by the window, for our 2-week stay. This arrangement was great for us because the sofa area meant we could hang out in the room without sitting on our beds; we also made use of the lovely lounge area on the 14th floor, where coffee, tea, and juices are always available. We picked the hotel because we wanted quiet for sleeping and a little extra comfort for buffering the challenges of Tokyo; our one worry in advance is that we would regret staying in more of a 'business' area of the city. We ended up not regretting it at all because the hotel is so conveniently located (near Mita, Tamachi, Shibakoen, and Akabanabashi stations, all of which we used)-it was easy to venture all over the city and know we'd have only a 5-10 minute walk to our quiet hotel at the end of the day. Shiba Park, nearby, was also fun to visit.We didn't eat in the hotel restaurants but ate at some other places in the neighborhood (including a friendly and extremely affordable Italian restaurant, Maruyama, which is only a few blocks away). We also took laundry to a coin-op laundromat that was about 3 blocks behind the hotel. We used the fitness room less than we'd expected, but it included treadmills and ellipticals plus some bands with handles and floor mats. We kept some provisions in the refrigerator in the room (yogurt, fruit, cheese) and managed to cater our own breakfasts most days plus some light snacks. (There is a small convenience store in the hotel and a number of others very nearby as well as a grocery store maybe 5 blocks away.) The hotel occupies 4 floors of a high-rise - hence our worries about the 'business' feel of the building and neighborhood - but we were really not aware of the non-hotel life of the building. The lobby is a hotel lobby with bar and restaurant; the four floors of the hotel (floors 14-18 - nice views) are somewhat self-enclosed, and from the hallway of the upper floors one looks down into the lounge and garden area of the hotel on the lowest 'hotel' floor. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful (for instance, someone found a scale so that we could weigh one of our suitcases). In short - we were not business travelers nor on a business traveler's budget, but the Celestine was a great home base for us and did not include any hidden costs. We felt extremely comfortable and were taken care of very well.

I chose this hotel as I had stayed here a few years earlier for a conference. I recalled it being comfortable and fairly central. I was not disappointed. A very warm welcome at reception in spite of our 6.30am arrival. Needless to say we couldn’t check in but our bags were cloaked and we were shown to the guest lounge where we could help ourselves to tea and coffee. We changed out of our travel clothes in the bathroom and set off. On our return our room was ready and our bags had been taken up. The room was a good size by Tokyo standards, lovely comfortable bed and pillows, a lounge and desk, tea/coffee etc. the bathroom was “cosy” with shower over bath but quite adequate. We organised luggage transfer to our next destination and it happened without a hitch. The area is quiet but has convenience stores, laundromat and restaurants within walking distance. Mita and Tamachi stations also within walking distance.Easy to do some great sightseeing on foot as well.

We stayed here for 4 nights. It was quiet when we visited as it was a national holiday. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The room was immaculate and had very nice style features, although size was an issue, which I will get to later. The hotel is very stylish with some nice added features, such as the reading lounge and outside seating areas. We did not eat in the hotel but it does have nice restaurants on site should you wish to do so. Our room was a "moderate room", which I would suggest is too small for a couple on an extended stay. The bed is right against the wall on one side with limited circulation generally in the rest of the room. There is only limited storage, consisting of 6 hangers in 2 of the shallowest wardrobes I have seen in a hotel. Having said that we still thoroughly enjoyed our stay and I would stay there again, but in a bigger room. It is well situated within walking distance of the Tokyo Tower, Zojoji Temple and Meiji Shrine. The subway system in Japan is amazing and we were spoilt for choice of stations close by. Overall I loved this hotel for its style and quiet elegance

The hotel is situated on walking distance from Tamachi station. Very friendly and welcoming staff. Rooms are suitable, and everything works. Huge selection of soap, shower gels and amenities. Beds are comfortable.

An exceedingly pleasant business stay for 3 nights in the last week of the blossom. Service was friendly and attentive, breakfasts excellent, 14th floor lounge for residents, free good quality Wi-fi . The hotel is very well located, just near the metro station and easy links into central Tokyo. A very minor point was the lack of drawers in the room (cupboard but limited storage) but not enough to detract from the overall impression.

Good enough for a short business trip. The hotel is fairly new and well equipped rooms. Restaurant options are also good and room service is good (just remember to order befoe 9 pm).Staff are very friendly and helpful..

This hotel is in a quieter part of Tokyo if that is at all possible. The staff were very helpful and friendly there knowledge of English was very good, lovely appointed room with all the services coffee tea making mini bar safe, comfortable bed and pillows. The 14 floor has a club lounge where coffee,tea, juices and biscuits provided.Would definitely stay here again.

We stayed at this hotel during our visit to Tokyo. It was our first time in the city and we found the hotel to be well located. The area is a pleasant and safe area mainly with businesses. The best thing is that there are two metro stations nearby including being on the circular Yanamota line (and Mita Station has a direct train to Narita airport although it is worth checking the times as it is not as regular as the local metro).The hotel lobby is impressive and the staff were all extremely friendly. I would suggest that they give local area maps to guests on check-in. We were not given one but upon talking to concierge during our stay, they provided one to us and it had various restaurants marked on the map too which was useful.The rooms are on higher floors. Our room was smaller than we expected, even by Tokyo standards, and it was hard to keep our suitcases out at once. The window gave us an amazing view of Tokyo city and the bay area, which was even better at night. The housekeeping could have been better.The hotel provides numerous toiletries and skippers and pajamas in the room, which was a nice touch. We were surprised to find a Seven Eleven and several restaurants actually attached to the hotel building on the ground floor - this was useful and the Seven Eleven do great coffees and pastries if you don't have breakfast included.We used the hotel lounge once but the complimentary drink selection was poor (coffee or tea from a machine, or carton juices) and there wasn't much atmosphere. However this wouldn't stop us from using the hotel again due to the location and helpfulness of the staff.

Its nice place to stay but nothing exeptional. Customer service in general is not the best. The location is good.Restaurant is nice for lunch or dinner but they have only 4 type of food and if you are not lucky you can have some very strict waiters serving who will make you feel like you are a child in the kindergarden.

The Celestine Shiba is a great hotel close to Ginza area. Itbis very clean, rooms are a bit small but nice. Hotel has a great lounge and fitness room. A clear recommendation if you visit central Tokyo.

review_body: Small but clean and adequate rooms. Breakfast buffet is superb. Service is good even by high Japanese standards. Excellent location and you can get to anywhere from the two nearby subway stations. The main train station is also close by. It is great value for the price.

We chose this hotel for its location and reviews we had read. We couldn't be more happy with the hotel Celestine and will defiantly be staying there again.The staff were fantastic and really made you feel welcome, right from the front desk to the bar and restaurant and even housekeeping. The room was a great size with an amazing view over the city our room number was 1655. The room was cleaned everyday to a high standard and room service was great. There is a lounge on the 14th floor which offers complementary tea coffee and soft drinks which is a great way to start the day before exploring the area. Tokyo tower is only a 10 min walk from the hotel which is great both in the day and night. The nearest subway is only a 3 min walk (MITA Station) but the best subway is (Tamachi Station) where you can travel to most of the main areas of Tokyo. Best way to unwind after a long day exploring Tokyo is to sit in the hotel bar with a glass of Suntory Hibiki Whisky as the bar staff were very friendly..

We can only say good things about the Celestine. The hotel is within very easy walking distance from the Mita station (5 or 6 stops from Tokyo Central). The moment you enter the spacious lobby the huzzle and buzzle from Tokyo city is left behind you, everything in the Celestine is tasteful and stylish. The check-in was quick and efficient, and the reception in general is very helpful and accomodating.We had a room on the 17th floor, with panoramic views over the City. Quite remarkable, really. The room is small (this is Tokyo), but well appointed, with all the main ammenities(including fresh bottled water every day). The breakfast buffet is a treat, please do yourself a favor and book it together with the room. Lots of menun options, and in a light, spacious room facing the street, which makes for interesting views in the morning.The real plus is the lounge on the 14 floor, this is open 24/7 and offers a comfortable and elegant room to retreat from your own room, particularly if your partner is still asleep while you are right awake at 4am in the morning. It offers coffee and tea. WiFi is free throughout the hotel.A great place, we loved it.

The Celestine is a very average hotel. Upon walking into the lobby, we were met with amazing, accommodating and friendly staff in a very beautiful lobby. Once we entered the room––it is simply a modest and clean hotel. Nothing more. Needs renovation. WIFI is extremely slow here, which is an issue if you rely on the internet to work remotely. I will not be back. I suggest for the same price, go to the Candeo Hotel. A much newer hotel that is affordable and modest, but most importantly––updated to modern comfortability, including fast WIFI.

We had a wonderful stay at the Celestine Shiba in a recently remodeled Superior Double room. As expected they are smaller than Western standards but comfortable with a small sitting area. Every day 2 bottled waters were provided. The room amenities were beyond anything I’ve ever experienced – robes, slippers, pajamas, unexpected toiletries like toothbrushes, a mini hairbrush, a razor, and shaving cream on top of the standard items you expect. Ladies, the hair dryer works really well. It styled my hair better than my own, LOL. The biggest plus is the phone they provide. We used it daily to help navigate around Tokyo. They also offer a currency exchange machine in the lobby. Just feed in your dollars and it spits out yen. Not sure how good the exchange rate was but it was super helpful and convenient. For breakfast we kept it simple by eating at Tully’s around the corner (closed on Sunday’s) or picking something up from FamilyMart, or Lawson’s. By the way, you can’t bring outside food to the 14th floor lounge. Very limited restaurant choices in the immediate area. We walked about .5 miles for more options or ate before we returned to the hotel. If you don’t speak Japanese, do your research. Look for places with English reviews and/or menus with pictures. The people are extremely nice and will go out of their way to help language barrier and all.Pick of train stations were plentiful. The hotel is located near four stations– Shibakoen, Mita, Tamachi, and Oshiage. All are within a 10 minute walk; Shibakoen is the closest, it’s only a block away. The train system is elaborate and intimidating but totally awesome once you learn how it works. I made arrangements for a private guide to show us around the city and teach us how the train system works. Best money ever spent. After our lesson we were pros. OK, maybe not pros but we got around and didn’t get lost, that’s success in my book. Our return trip to Narita Airport was pretty simple. From the Mita Station (5 minute walk), take the Asakusa Line (airport express train). No transfers, just a direct shot. It was half the price of taking the Airport Limousine bus and faster. Don’t get me wrong, the Airport Limousine bus is also a great option. Pickup/dropoff is right outside the hotel so it is super convenient, less stress, and a no brainer. We took it from Narita airport to the hotel. There is ticket counter at the airport once you exit custom/immigration and the bus stop is curbside right outside the door. There are lots of airport transportation options, I found these two to be the best ones for Celestine Shiba as far as price and convenience.

I would have loved to rate it higher, but an incident on the last night really ticked me off.We had planned to go for a really good restaurant for dinner and asked the concierge to book a table for us. We got confirmed from him and went out and about until dinner time.When we showed up we were told that they had canceled our reservation and offered us a place in a sofa as they were overbooked. It turned out that they had informed our concierge about this, but he had not passed the info on to us. We got a written apology next morning but had to go to bed having had a club sandwich in the hotel lobby instead of a Michelin style dinner.

Our stay was on April 2015, Very nice hotel., not in the tourists area but very close to the metro station and the bus station so you can move in Tokyo with ease. The room was clean but very small but this is very normal in Tokyo. Staff was very friendly and helpful. If you look for a good price and quiet hotel this one is a good choice.

Was very happy with this hotel considering how much we paid for our room. We got it on sale in Expedia and my guess is we travelled during off-peak season in Tokyo. We arrived past midnight and staff greeted us kindly, checked us in quick, helped bring our lugagges to our room. The room was great. Small to our North American standards but we knew that’s what to expect in Japan and it was still comfortable. The room had so many amenities available I don’t normally see in North America or Europe - free pocket wifi (in addition to the free hotel wifi), different room lighting (appeciated the foot lighting for night time), 2 fresh pajama sets every night (in addition to hotel bath robes and slippers), ironing board is in the room and need not be requested from front desk, freshener spray for both clothes and air, facial care kit (face milk, face wash, toner, face cream), etc. The gym was also nearby and I noticed people using them - we didn’t. We had good use of the 24-hour lounge that was also on our floor. It had 24-hour coffee and tea, orange juice was served during the day. People were there working on their laptops. We saw a family with a baby once in there, so I guess the hotel is also baby-friendly. The area around the hotel is quiet at night as it is a business area surrounded by offices. I liked that this hotel was not in the busy areas of Tokyo like Shibuya, Shinjuku, Harajuku, or Akihabara. There were a few metro stations within walking distance - Mita and Tamachi are what we used often. It was also a quick ride from Haneda airport which was nice so we got to take a cab to/from the hotel. Overall, this hotel was great value for our money! Would love to come back.

My best stay in Tokyo. We travelled as a group of four. On arrival we were received by friendly and professional staff. The hotel has a beautiful lounge with free coffee and juice. We spent most of our time in the hotel’s common areas. The hotel provided us with pajamas everyday during our stay. I must say the hotel is very neat and close to both the metro and JR station.

We stayed there for 3 nights for over Valentine’s and really loved the hotel. The hotel is very elegant and the service was like staying at a 5 star hotel. We booked a corner room and it had an amazing view. If you can, I would highly recommend upgrading to a corner view. Unlike their regular rooms, it is very spacious and comes with a huge bathroom! My husband loved all the very nice amenities they have in the room and I loved the guest lounge they have on the 14th floor. It was nice after a long day sightseeing to just relax with a cup of tea or coffee. There is also a nice little spa on site and both my husband and I really enjoyed our massages. The gym is small and does not have any free weights, but they have cardio equipment. The food both at the full restaurant and cafe were really delicious. We tried breakfast at both and I would say you can save money by booking the room without the breakfast included and just order what you want when you get there. The nice thing about the hotel is that it is a quiet oasis within busy Tokyo. Even though they are in a central location, they are close to both a subway and rail station, it is very quiet around the hotel. I believe the rooms have sound proof windows because we really didn’t hear any street noise either. We were also able to visit Tokyo Tower and a few other places close by. If we ever come back to Tokyo then I would definitely stay here again!

This hotel is near subway station and also very close to Tokyo Tower. The staff gave me a room located on the highest floor according to my request. The most incredible thing is that I can see Fuji mountain in my room! The breakfast is also very excellent. Every food provided is delicious! The most important thing is all the staff are very nice and professional. I am definitely gonna recommend this hotel to all my friends if they are going to visit Tokyo

A calm port in the busy city of Tokyo. There is a quiet guest lounge with indoor and outdoor seating on the 3rd floor. The staff is very friendly and many speak English. The breakfast is incredible. Rooms as in any Japanese Hotel are small but well appointed.

Very clean and nice hotel.Quite spacious for Japan’s standards, and it’s a good value for your money.The staff is amazing and offer really good service.Location is pretty good and walking distance from metro stations.

A trip to Tokyo wouldn’t be the same for us now without a stay at the Celestine. This was our third visit (in November 2018) & we were interested to see the renovations. We were not disappointed; the rooms looked really lovely with lots of Japanese touches in the lamps & soft furnishings. We stayed in Superior Doubles & particularly liked the little sofas. We awoke to a feint view of Mount Fuji on the first morning- a pleasant surprise! I don’t think the bathrooms have been renovated but they were absolutely fine. We were so pleased that the lovely marble Reception area had been retained. A bonus in this hotel is the 14th floor coffee lounge with outdoor space. It’s an easy 10 minute walk from Tamachi Station or 15 minutes from Hamamatsucho. If I had remembered that the Airport Limo bus stops at the Celestine we may have taken that!The breakfasts in the restaurant & the cafe in the Foyer are both very good. There is a Tulleys Coffee Shop at the side of the Celestine & a convenience store beyond Tulleys (about 3 minutes away). You can take a walk to Tokyo Tower in 10-15 minutes from here.The service is excellent. All in all a lovely hotel. We may visit again!

This is a classy hotel with professional service all the way around. The breakfasts were top notch with Western and Japanese cuisine. There is a cook station where you can request eggs and their daily specials such as beef or pork cutlets. Lobby is well appointed and makes a great impression. The Tamachi train station (8 min walk) and the Mita station (3 min walk) close by made it very convenient to get around. Having stayed there over the New Year holidays, the hotel was offering the "toshikoshi" soba noodles which are traditionally served during this time to welcome in the new year. Yummy! With all of these positives, I was able to bear the "moderate double" which had a queen bed pushed against one wall and the space was small by American standards. It was also very quiet. The guest lounge access made for a good spot to congregate and unwind. Complimentary teas and coffee but wine and beer are not.

Perfectly situated, Hotel The Celestine Tokyo Shiba, was the perfect base for a working trip. Recently renovated, from the stylish lobby to the guest floors and rooms, the hotel oozes Japanese chic and is comfortable and welcoming. The rooms are typically on the small side by Western business standards but are functional and comfortable. First class stay!

So this being my first trip to Tokyo based on this experience, I look forward to my second trip already! The staff at the hotel go that extra mile to make you feel very welcomed and comfortable during your stay. A staff member by the name of Allison Smith gave me some great locations to visit during my stay. She was like the Sat nav for Tokyo. I always had something to do day and night based on her recommendations! When I visit again I will be staying here again. 5 stars all the way.

We stayed 4 nights in a Superior Twin room. We chose this as the Superior Double appears to have a bed that's only 160cm wide. With the Superior Twin, the two twin beds are so close together that it feels like a huge king size bed! The hotel is in a nice quiet business district but we found some cute little streets close by for food. The staff are so polite and helpful and greeted us with a smile every time we walked through the peaceful lobby. The rooms are very comfortable with soft linen and large beds. The room wasn't huge but with the lovely window seat, you had a nice place to sit. The rooms come with everything you need, including an ironing board/iron and really nice white pyjamas! We had requested a quiet room on a high level with a view and I was so happy as they gave us a view that, though it looked onto another building, you could see the Rainbow Bridge clearly between the buildings.The breakfast was fantastic with fresh, good quality food and lots of variety. I was particularly impressed by Sumi who would remember that I liked soy milk and she'd bring it to me without me asking for it!The location means you need to catch a couple of trains to areas like Shibuya or Shinjuku, but the train travel is all part of the Tokyo experience. Staying 4 nights we became familiar with the quickest train lines to take.The gym is small so don't expect too much here but the lounge is a nice quiet space to sit.The only thing I would change is the pillows. They are quite small and one was too soft, one too hard. Apparently they do have foam pillows, which I prefer, but they were all taken.We really loved this hotel and highly recommend it for a high quality, comfortable, serene place to stay. It almost feels like a 5-star hotel.

Easy to reach on the train from the airport, the hotel provides excellent facilities. In the morning there is juice and coffee to sit in a lounge common area and the bathrooms have the most complementary toiletries I’ve ever seen.The staff are super nice and try their best to help you out even with the language barrier. One thing I will mention is don’t use their currency machine as it has terrible rates. Go to a nearby money exchange. Also gym could use some weights but it’s got they have tried to accomodate those who are cardio inclined.Overall great experience and would visit again.

This hotel was recommended by a relative. Thank you relative. Talk about friendly and helpful, when was the last time you checked into a hotel and after registering the lady clerk behind the counter came out and helped carry your luggage to your room. The room was typical Japanese small but afforded a wonderful view of the city from 14 floors up. The large guest lounge with concierge was just around the corner and offered up complimentary coffee and juice. Nice size bathroom with good shower and a toilet seat with some surprises attached (it's our secret). The bar lounge on the main floor was big and had a limited breakfast, lunch and dinner menu but a larger bar menu. Taxis were always nearby or out front. So, put together smiles, throw in friendliness and round it out with a helpful staff and it spells Celestine Tokyo Shiba.

My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights and found this hotel to exceed our expectations, as regular stayers of Tokyo Station Hotel we will be staying at Celestine for all future trips to Tokyo.Reception was quick and efficient with friendly smiles, and as soon as we walked into reception staff quickly greeted us and took our luggage. The room was lovely, fresh and very clean and big nough for the two of us.Buffet breakfast was excellent with a large variety of food on offer, and the curry is a must try they also offer sparkling wine for breakfast too.The bar in the lobby is small, but very good the service was first class by all serving drinks especially the young lady making me excellent martini, unfortunately I cannot temper her name but she was such a professional.We could not fault this hotel, it’s beautiful, friendly and first class.Only minor compliant would be due to a marathon being held no taxis was available at hotel and was very difficult to take our luggage over the walk way crossing the road.Thank you for a wonderful stay and hospitality, look forward to seeing you soon.Erol

I very rarely give five stars but this place fully deserves them. I stayed here 2 years ago and loved it, and it’s only gotten better. The guest rooms are on the 14th-17th floor, high above the city, and my view was great. One clear morning, I was even able to see Mt Fuji! The room is tastefully decorated, very warm and appealing, with a firm but not overly hard king size bed. Everything looks well maintained and in good shape, there’s some complimentary water, and while the room is not huge, it would be okay for two people. Not realizing the difference between room types, I’d originally booked a “moderate” room, the cheapest type, only to find that these rooms face towards the inside and are tiny. I took one look at the room and marched right back to the reception and asked for an upgrade. I paid an extra JPY 2000 per night for my much nicer room.The lobby is particularly appealing, very tastefully decorated, almost a five-star boutique hotel feel. The café in the lobby, Cellecroix, serves a breakfast tray in the morning if breakfast is not included in your rate, and it’s okay if you just need a small breakfast. There’s unlimited coffee refills. Otherwise, the hotel restaurant does a decent breakfast buffet, quality over quantity, with nice pastries and eggs cooked to order, but at JPY 2800 a bit pricey for what you get. The space in the restaurant is much improved over the bland and cold atmosphere from two years ago.Staff are unfailingly friendly, though most front desk staff have limited English—enough to get routine tasks done but they struggle if things get a bit more complicated. The location of the hotel is not in the center of the hustle and bustle of Tokyo but Toei’s Mita Station is a 5 minute walk away, so is Shiba-koen Station, and JR’s Tamachi Station is a couple of minutes more. I found the transport links very convenient. There are full-on eating streets behind Mita Station with endless choices of restaurants, and convenience stores all over the place.Overall, Celestine is a great place to stay in Tokyo, and I’ve already booked my next stay.

We stayed in the hotel Dec 2018. The rooms 1434 and 1435 were beautifully decorated, a reasonable size and the beds extremely comfortable. Plenty of facilities in the room, including a mobile phone for use during our stay. The guest lounge on level 14 is a nice touch and offers coffee, tea and juice free of charge. Staff were always polite and friendly. The hotel is in a business district and so is very quiet at night, however many great little eateries are only about 5 minute walk away. Ask the concierge for a map of the local area. The subway is only a few minutes and JR Tamachi station about 10 minutes walk. There is a 7/11 downstairs at the rear of the hotel and a coin operated laundry around the corner. The Limousine bus from Narita stops at the hotel, but is the last on the run and takes about 2 hours. We did not try the breakfast. All in all a lovely hotel in a quiet location.

one of the best breakfast in the world. super nice staff and all day launge for you to work and have meetings if necessary. it has good locations for restaurants and walking distance from MITA station which is great for people who come from Haneda airport. the only downside is a small fitness room without free weights to work with.... but still, this one is my choice in Tokyo.

Very good hotel: friendly and efficient staff, sizeable and well equiped rooms, and very quiet! All in all a very pleasant experience and exactly what I was looking for in a business hotel. Hope to return again!

I had the opportunity of staying here again, for three nights (Sept. 9-11, 2018), on a business trip. I have previously reviewed this place twice and all the positive things I said about this place still applies. Renovations were in progress on my last visit and I had alerted readers about this fact.Renovations are now complete and I am also glad to say the management has responded positively to several little niggles I had noted previously. First, they are now supplying two bottles of mineral water to the rooms everyday. Second, they now also place black tea bags in the room for those who do not fancy flavored or flowery teas. These features were absent on my previous visits. A further touch was that a sweet lady prepared eggs to my preference at the breakfast cafe; an egg station like this was missing before, although I must add that the lady was not always present to take orders. She was there on the first morning but not the second, and we were back to eating mass prepared scrambled eggs. One little complaint remains at the cafe. There were all kinds of flavored tea there but breakfast tea (black tea) was not available and my attempts to communicate this to a waiter were not fruitful. He simply did not understand what I was asking for and kept offering me the teas that were laid out there.The renovated, rooms while looking fresh and clean, appeared to be smaller than before, possibly because of a slightly different layout. I am talking about rooms facing the court yard from the 14th floor up. I cannot comment on the outer rooms as I did not see their interiors. I found the absence of a work desk particularly disconcerting as I had to use a small stool to accommodate my laptop. This would bother people on business trips more than those on leisure outings, I admit.Perhaps the best (and new) feature was the availability of a smartphone in each room that allows guests to make and receive unlimited local calls and international calls (to a few destinations) completely free of charge. Guests are allowed to carry it out with them when they leave the hotel for meetings or tours. This obviates the need to invest in a local SIM card, particularly for those on short visits.And as always, I enjoyed the lounge on the 14th floor that provides complimentary juices, good teas (including breakfast teas) and cookies to relax after long business meetings. In good weather one can sit out in the adjacent court yard and relax with the drinks and cookies.This hotel is easily accessible from the airports (Narita and Hanneda), is within walking distance of Tokyo tower, and has some famous Japanese shrines located in the vicinity. The staff are friendly and courteous, as always, and when it rained, sturdy umbrellas were provided for our use with compliments of the hotel.Yes, I will continue to be a guest here when I am in Tokyo.

This is so far the best hotel I have ever stayed at during all my trips to Tokyo. It is located between subway stations Mita and Shibakoen. From this hotel you can easily reach Tokyo Narita and Tokyo Haneda Airport. The staff speaks well English. The room is convenient and clean. Tokyo Tower is close to this hotel. I really liked this hotel and would definately recommend it.

I stayed at the hotel for 4 nights.I had an amazing experience. Staff was very cooperative and polite. Starting from Reception, housekeeping, concierge, breakfast, room.Additionally the view from my room was spectacular.Definitely will stay again here and recommend others too!

Mind you, i stay up to 240 days per year in Hotels in Asia!The hotel is on the top 4 floors of the building with lobby and breakfast at the ground floorIt's relative close to several train stations , 7 to 15 min walking distance and you get anywhere you want to goWorking space and room size, typically Japanese hotel, this is not a western international hotel, even there the rooms are not as large as we are used too, talking about 4 or 5 star hotels.There is a "lounge" with space to work on the 11 Th floor, sometimes quite noisy so not a place to workFood as for breakfast is great where over 10 days, every day the same, not a very inspired chef at the hotel, typical Japanese Summary:Not the place to stay again, Shinagawa or Tokyo has better choices in the same price range

Stayed at Celestine Tokyo near Mita station recently and was surprised to find the price went up by more than 20% after the renovation.The size of the room remains the same just additional flat screen TV, a bottle of mineral water, use of mobile phone as well as iron board, safe etc in the wardrobe. I do not find these necessary. However, breakfast is good and of course the service has always been good. I do not see the reason for a high price hike and will not recommend to stay here.

Really good service and excellent service. They even let us leave our bags there in the morning on the check-in date and come back in the afternoon to get to our room.Stayed with my wife and 4 year old daughter. They even provided a kids amenity pack. Breakfast buffet was really good, better get in early otherwise it gets a bit crowded and you will have to wait for a while.

Very recently we stayed for the first time in Japan and so I don't know if this standard of hospitality is uniform but we adored this hotel. Recently refurbished, it is well located, quiet, intimate and tastefully decorated in a manner that satisfies every need for comfort, respite and aesthetic pleasure!

This hotel surprised me a lot by its fantastic services and amazing breakfasts - way better than many 5 star hotels. Good location close to metro stations. Stayed there 6 nights but would stay longer if possible.

If your looking for a better than average hotel and flying in or out from Haneda you can’t go past The Celestine at Shiba. Bigger than the oppressive 11 sq meter room and only a short walk from Mita Station (4 stops from Haneda) it was a great choice.

Stayed here for 5 nights, although it is more of a business district it is only a short walk to Hamamatsucho Bus and train station where a lot of tours leave from and also in the other direction is a great eating area that the locals all go to. Down side is that there is about zero English but that is half the fun! The hotel rooms and small as expected but very cosy and a comfortable bed. All the staff were great and I can't remember having a single issue there other than they really don't understand how confusing the subway system is there to visitors and directions sometimes need to be questioned. Our room had an ok view but that is not important to me at all when on holiday.I would definitely stay here again.

The staff at the reception is excellent. They are very thoughtful and exemplify omotenashi service. We takyubin (delivery) service our suitcases to the next hotel.The staff even looked for us in the coffee shop to fill out the missing information.

This Hotel is worthy of a 5 star. The service is very caring, and the staff is of irreproachable kindness.The location of the hotel is in a rather chic and central area, not far from the Tokyo Tower and Roppongi. And not far from Haneda airport.The rooms are spacious and comfortable, and a cleanliness found only in Japan.

Lovely hotel near to public transport with Tamachi station (on the Yamanote line) and with a good location near Shiba park and Tokyo tower within a 5 minute walk. Quiet area during the weekend as it's a business district but a few bars and restaurants around 5 minutes walk. Comfortable bed, decent shower. A great view of the river and the Rainbow Bridge from our room. Great breakfast with eggs and burgers cooked to order. Loved the 'handy' 4G phone device in the room which you can take around Tokyo with you to help navigation! Brilliant idea!

I loved this hotel, rooms are tiny but very efficient, bed is super comfy (you can literally fell asleep in 1 second!) and common areas are very stilish and elegant. The staff is great (I was super late in breakfast time and they allowed me in anyway). Breakfast is simply amazing!

Great experience in the property. However our rooms had no views whatsoever. Although the rooms are small we didn’t mind as we never spent time in the room. The coffee lounge and other outdoor sitting space made up for the room. The hotel provides pajamas and slippers every day. However, housekeeping didn’t clean the rooms for the 4 days we spent at property

You will feel like you're in more of a financial district than Times Square staying at this hotel because everyone outside is in business formal and most of the guests are there on business. That said, this hotel has a lounge with free water/coffee all day (one of my most favorite perks lol) and is about 2-3mins walking distance from some of the central subway lines that can take you all around Tokyo! It was actually nice at the end of the day to leave "the crazy" behind and head back to the peaceful neighborhood that the Celestine is located (since it's in a business district, there aren't any wild tourists partying in the streets on a late night - you'll definitely rest if you aren't jet lagged). The people and service were also amazing. Definitely recommend!

My wife and I had a great stay at the Celestine Tokyo Shiba. The service is awesome. Staff friendly. We had a great view of the Sumida river and the Fuji building as well as the Ferris wheel which is lit up at night.My wife travelled for business and I went on to visit Tokyo.Location is near three subway stations.

The staff here are always accommodating and cannot do enough for you. It is 5 star service all the time. The accommodations are also very good and consistent. It was a 5 day business trip and I was needing to work from the hotel on many occasions. The staff always accommodated!This will continue to be my first choice of hotel when going to Tokyo.

Finding The Celestine was a stroke of luck. It was a perfect place to stay for a few days, and very reasonably priced.Location: Not bad at all! It's a quiet, mostly residential neighbourhood, and the hotel is exactly half way between two Subway stations, about 20 minutes from Tokyo central railway station. However, just a few minutes walk from the hotel there is a maze of characterful, narrow Japanese streets packed with an amazing array of places to eat. The receptionist gave us a map and pointed this area out to us, and we spent a happy hour exploring it, after eating the best damn bowls of ramen either of us had ever had, and pigging out on gyoza.The hotel isn't too far from the fun, either. We were able to walk back from Ginza (via the seedy lights of Shimbashi) in less than an hour - once it had got dark and the heat had gone from the day.It's also right next to Tokyo Tower, which is a good spot to start sightseeing.The room: Oh, so small!! But, with a couple of tiny closets, and some very imaginative designs making good use of the available space, we were able to make ourselves comfortable. Everything was very clean, the furniture and fittings were in very good condition and seemed quite new, and the bed was totally comfortable. The aircon worked effectively, and - so convenient - a mobile charger with every plug imaginable was provided. It even did USB C.My companion was delighted with the bathroom amenities, especially the bag of lotions and other unguents. She knows about these things, so if she was happy, they were obviously worth having.Food: We only ate in the hotel once, and that was a breakfast buffet. It was pretty nice; good Japanese and western selection, some freshly-prepared dishes, a good choice of food, frequently replenished. Not bad at all!The Lounge: This is the hotel's stand-out feature. On the 14th floor there is a large and well-designed lounge with indoor and outdoor areas, comfy seats for discussing the day's plans, and a big, long table with power sockets for working. There's free soft drinks, iced coffee, juice, and hot tea and coffee from a machine, and you can buy a beer. It's open 24 hours, but only the tea/coffee machine is available out-of-hours. The best thing is that this lounge has a staff member during the day, who is available to help with any queries you might have about things to do, places to go, transport, or anything else - and they WERE helpful, patient, and very good at English. We started and ended every day in the lounge.Check-in/check-out: Quick, easy, no problems at all.It's difficult finding an affordable hotel in Tokyo that captures that fine balance between Japanese hospitality and accessibility for foreigners, but the Celestine does it with confidence, and I'd definitely stay here again.

We stayed here for one day before leaving Japan. We switched to this hotel based on the ratings and it was worth it. First of all, the hotel is well located; there are some public transportation stations near so you can move around easily. Also, they offer Handy phones in your room and this is a great feature, in my opinion. The hotel is not very new, but is gorgeous, you can tell they maintain the place spot-on, as you can see in the pictures. The room was spacious and had an amazing view of the Tokyo bay. The A/C was not the best we had, but cooled down the room enough to have a good night sleep. Also, we had breakfast included as a courtesy, because our room had a little problem to begin with (was a small and insignificant thing). Thanks to Hiroshi for personally come to our room and offer an apology. Now that I mentioned the manager, I would like to say something about their staff, by far is the best staff ever during our stay in Japan (consider that our other experiences were nothing but spectacular). From the beginning, the ladies at the front were very nice and helpful, but Abiko was the bomb! She was two steps ahead of us when we had a problem (like forgetting the safe box's combination) or booking our airport limousine. She is the best. We would recommend this hotel any time.
