review_body: Stayed in this hotel for six nights in July of 2018. The lobby, elevators, hallways, rooms all very clean and well appointed. Rooms are pretty small, with a double bed taking up the majority of the space in the room. Corner rooms are quite a bit larger. Bathrooms are well-sized and well appointed. Bed was very comfortable. The 14th floor lounge offers both an indoor and outdoor place to relax. Free coffee is available 24/7. Service was quite good: friendly, polite, and professional. Location is OK. There's not a great deal in the immediate area, and public transportation options are not extensive, but there is a subway and JR Yamanote line within pretty easy walking distance. Overall my impression was positive. I probably wouldn't seek out this particular hotel to stay again in the future, but if the price was right I would certainly stay again, and be comfortable.

Rooms are extremely well equipped, the room amenities are the best we have ever seen (you get everything you could possibly need).Staff are super friendly, helpful and professional! Facilities are great. Perfect experience!

The hotel is beautiful, the free coffee in the lounge a nice touch, the bed is comfortable (except for the pillows that flatten out while you sleep), and the shower has good water pressure. All pre-requisites for a good hotel stay, right? The most impressive though was the breakfast buffet. There is a good variety of food to choose from, but what we came to love was their daily curry. Who knew curry for breakfast was the way to go?! The location is also a plus--easy to get to from Haneda airport, short walk to the JR Tamachi station, extremely short walk to near Shibakoen and Mita subway stations. We had no problems navigating around the city with all the transportation options. They even give you a smartphone to use during your stay for free calling and internet, but we didn't need it because we had already rented a pocket wifi device and were content using our own phones. Would stay there again given the reasonable price for what we got.

Great hotel, well located. Staff excellent.Can confirm that the rooms are small and luxurious as to what is provided.Close to Haneda airport, so it was not a long journey which was great after arriving late in the evening.

I was a little bit skeptical staying the hotel because was told the room is very small. Although the room indeed turn up to be small I still finding the lobby and the lounge on the 15th floor if I’m not mistaken give me so much comfort and allow us to relax after a busy day. The design of the lobby and lounge is superb but if they can make the room to be bigger it will he perfect. The breakfast selection was also good.

I stayed here for 4 nights as part of a business trip. I had a superior room which was very comfortable, however the storage was a little lacking as there were no drawers. There was a paper shredder!The breakfast in both the lobby and the restaurant were good. The staff were also very helpful with directions and taxi bookings. It is around 25 mins (6000 yen) from Haneda airport. The lounge on the 14th floor with outside seating and soft drinks was a nice touch.Many of the sites were 20 minutes away on the train, but the station is only an 8 minute walk away so this wasn't a big deal

We stayed in the Celestine twice during our trip to Japan. Although the rooms are smallish - but that seems to be the case with most hotels in Japan- they are very well appointed and comfortable, and the bathrooms were excellent. Staff speaks English and was friendly and helpful.Breakfast is quite expensive, but worth doing at least once: their Asian buffet selection is superb. The hotel is in a business area and has a fairly large bar/coffee/lounge area where quite a few local (?) business people seem to meet. It is quite nice. Tip: coffee is not very good and expensive, so best to go around the corner where there is an excellent coffee shop!Although in a business area, its location less than 10 minutes walk from Timachi station makes it quite central and well positioned in the Tokyo underground system. There is a wide variety of restaurants close to Timachi station, say 8 minutes walk from the hotel, as well as two 24hr convenience stores, which are very well stocked and accept credit cards.All up we were very happy with our stay and would stay again at a next visit.If possible, try to get a room with city views: these are quite impressive.

Hotel is very good located arriving from Haneda airport. Use monorail for roughly 500 yen, and then either walk 1,2km or take cab for 800 yen. From Hotel you have 300 m to next subway station, so very convenient.Complimentary drinks (hot drinks), iced coffee, wate4 and orange juice available all day in lounge. As well always 2 bottles of water in the room.Best surprise in the room though was a mobile device for usage during our stay. You could phone or google ....and use as guide to the requested location. Absolutely awesome, helpful and obviously convenient !! Best thing ever!! Room is a bit on the small side, but I believe ‚that’s tokio‘ :-)We were absolutely happy with the hotel, staff friendly, and rooms clean!! Definitely recommendable

Stayed in this hotel on May 8 and check out on the 12, room number 1516. We had a pleasant stay and would like to recommend this hotel for all traveler who’s going to visit Tokyo, Japan.The hotel has an easy access to reach downtown Tokyo, either using the JR train line or subway.This hotel in Minato area close to a lot of temples around, Shiba park and restaurant nearby.The staff are amazing, they are very helpful and nice, they have staff that speak French, Korea and most of them speak fluent English.The room option is available based on your budget, we stayed in queen bed room, enough space for Japan standards, very clean and has confortable bed.We really enjoyed our stay here and surely will be back again soon :)The picture taken from our room view at night

My partner and I opted for the superior twin room (so we could push the beds together and pretend it was a king). After staying in Airbnb’s for the majority of our trip, the Celestine was an absolute god send for the last three nights. The room had a lovely view, was quiet and very comfortable. You are provided with pjs, robes, slippers and all you could need toiletries. The bath is a fantastic size for an average sized adult. The tv only has Japanese channels and no subtitles - or at least I could not get ours to work. There is a small couch in the room, however level 14 has a large seating area where you can sit in or outside and relax. The gym has cardio equipment and no weights.The day spa is really lovely but is quite expensive.We paid extra to have breakfast included, it’s a decent range of western and Japanese foods. There is coffee and juices available also. The staff on the check in desk are amazing and speak very good English.The hotel is within a short walking distance to train stations, is located in a safe business area and close to a park. Overall we really enjoyed our stay.

Excellent customer service, immaculate rooms. Very impressed! I was surprised by the focused and attentive staff which is rare to find in such a large hotel. Excellent location with great metro accès. Great stay. After all the other mediocre places we stayed during our 2 week trip, this was a pleasant surprise.

This hotel offers you comfortable stays. We stayed Superior double room. The room is furnished enough.The bathroom is not large but the bathtub is big enough for stretching my legs.The lounge is quite good because we anybody can use it for 24 hrs and drink free-serviced drinks.(I could read a book comfortably!)The only point I disappointed is the location. No stores are open around the hotel on Sunday.

Good location, close to train station taking you wherever you need to go. Within walking distance to Tokyo Tower (there's also a small park for kids if you have little ones that need to burn some energy).The rooms are clean and of a decent size. Good amenities (and even a little kids care-package). Lounge upstairs serves coffee and juice. Lobby bar closes really early and the kitchen doesn't offer food past 10pm, not great for anyone arriving in the city late (there is a Lawson a few blocks away with decent food options). Overall an ok hotel if you need to stay in the area.

The room is a bit packed though with all major features and functions embedded to make sure guest feels comfortable. Unfortunately I could not see the Tokyo Tower this time. Toiletries are well provided. It is close to Mita and Shibakoen station, just a bit far from Tamachi JR station though still acceptable. It is quiet and undisturbed inside the room which is very good. The only two points I'd like to say for improvement are: 1) The lounge on 14F could serve some more food other than just drinks. More books from different countries could be provided for a leisure reading. 2) More room charge were paid for twin beds however did not expect the two beds are adjacent to each other. And only 1 breakfast is included which sounds not so friendly. Apart from these, the overall experience is pretty nice. Thank you.

Comfortable room with a view of Tokyo Tower. Within walking distance to Mita train station and Tamachi JR. Well maintained and clean hotel. Love the loungue with free flow of coffee. The loungue is a great place to chat, work or chill.

This hotel is located in a quiet area of Minato-ku, with a lovely lobby and lounge area. It is a quiet hotel very good for business travellers. I was on a business trip and for my meetings the hotel was central. The staff very polite and helpful, the facilities clean and very comfortable. I will definitely stay again.

This hotel was perfect. Excellent service and facilities and very well located. It's an excellent hotel to hold business meetings and the staff are extremely helpful and very kind. I will definitely be back

We stayed in this hotel for two nights and recommend it. Its very clean, modern quiet hotel. Nice coffee lounge. The rooms are small, atypical of Tokyo, its within walking distance of the metro and local shops. In a very peaceful quite area, bliss to comeback to. The nearest metro is Shibakoen Station and not Mita station as suggested by the hotels website. The former is about 3 mins walk whereas the latter is about 20 mins walk.

Another great hotel from the Celestine group, it is well located, within easy reach of a metro station, and has everything you need on site (including several restaurants, and an attached 7/11, which we found incredibly useful).We booked the corner double and it was wonderful - very large, and positively enormous by Japanese standards. The room was bright and airy, with excellent views, a large comfortable bed, spacious bathroom, desk and sitting area. We were travelling as a family (with a 4 years old and 10 month old) and could not recommend this highly enough for those with children.

This newly renovated hotel is very well located especially if you value peace and quiet at night. The beds are very comfy, they have a choice of pillows, I even managed to get a contour pillow! Bathrooms are spotless. There is a great Lounge area on Level 14 with free teas, expresso and juice. it's a great spot to spread out if you are in a smaller room.It also has outdoor patio areas at the Lounge. The staff are polite as expected. It is 5 mins walk to three different train lines, and 5 min in taxi to Ginza area and the Haneda Monorail. Almost next door is Zojo-ji Temple, Shiba Park and the Tokyo Tower. The Japanese restaurant is also good. It is a quiet and safe area, and we thoroughly recommend this hotel. If you need to be in a party atmosphere, then look elsewhere, this is a refined and respectful hotel.

Beautiful, modern hotelRooms spotlessly clean, large comfortable room Very comfortable bed,Good locationGreat value for moneyFriendly, professional & helpful staff- staff can speak English which is very helpful for English travellers who cannot speak JapaneseWi-Fi- excellentGorgeous breakfasts! wide variety of food & drinks available Lovely peaceful/quiet rooms to stay infree coffee/tea/juice on 14th floorlovely patio to sit out on *Tip*- request room with excellent view on 17th floor if possible as we stayed on 17th floor room 1716 and our view was stunning of Tokyo buildings, looked great on the night time too all lit up!

It is the first visit since the hotel was newly installed. Room amenities are plentiful. Even with the sudden staying of ladies, because there are many lady's items in the bathroom, you can stay here without cosmetics. The slippers are also fluffy in fabric bags, easy to take away. There is also a sofa on the window, it makes your stay to relax.

I agree with another review, the rooms aren’t huge but then that’s Tokyo, space is at a premium. The staff are lovely, quality and decor of rooms really good and it’s located well for various underground / subway stations. Also a pleasant walk into some of the charming buzzing little restaurants nearby (see my other reviews if you fancy tempura or ramen) and easy to get to the airport, to Ginza, to the bullet train etc. Coming back to stay again soon and no need to find another hotel, this one has all we need including lounge area, fitness room, spa and bar. Thanks Hotel Celestine

My husband and I recently stayed at the Celestine Tokyo Shiba for a few days. The location is excellent, the quality of the rooms and the service impeccable, Although one might wonder why it takes so many employees to serve a cup off tea, but then again this is Japan. I highly recommend this Hotels’s any businessman, woman, or any traveler seeking comfort in Tokyo.

This hotel is ok but not at the level of the other 2 hotels I stayed at in Japan over 8 days.Pros: Excellent Bar, Clean, Proximity to Mita train station & Tokyo TowerCons: Language Ability of Staff, Room Size

Was here for 5 nights for a long business trip and was genuinely surprised. The room is huge by Tokyo standards and the bathroom also very big by Tokyo standards. The room was very clean and all staff very professional. It is notable that the bath tube plastic mat is very clean and the shower curtain was mould-free, did not smell and only changed in Nov.The amenities are from L'occitane which means I can actually use them (always worry about allergies if from a brand I have never used before).The laundry service was good and there is a nespresso machine in the room. They also have a air purifier with humidifying function which is very good in dry Tokyo. One notable feature of this hotel is the 24 hr lounge at 14th floor with tea and coffee. It is really a very convenient place to work.It is about 5 minutes walk from the nearest metro though if you are carrying luggage the accessible exit from metro is a bit further.One suggestion to the hotel if you are reading this. Like many hotels though, when cleaning bath tub the staff probably did not clear the drains of hair because it started getting slightly blocked from the fourth night.

Above average no complain. Accommodation is quite good. Rooms are small but clean and adequate level.But some rooms are far from the elevator. Because only 1 elevator hall was set for one floor with square layout.There are lots of restaurants around Mita and Tamachi station. So bed and breakfast use is recommended.If room rate for the superior twin room is around 18,000 yen, you will feel the value.
user_name:
順一郎 佐
Chiyoda-ku, Tokyo, Japan

review_body: They have good amenities in the room, face wash and cleansing is quite good. Also they have the bath salt and bath gel so you can enjoy several types when take bath.Breakfast is from 7:00 AM however I have the conference meeting to join from 7:00 in my room. If it starts little earlier, I could enjoy their breakfast too.

Few steps from Mita and Tamachi station, very good location. Super helpful and welcoming staff, the lobbies are pretty cool, the rooms super comfortable and clean. Big comfortable beds, big bath tubs with fully equipped bathroom kit. Even the free wifi carrier device offered for the free wifi wherever you go. Pretty cool!

I stayed here with a friend for a week when our Air BnB didn't meet our expectations. As soon as we arrived at Hotel Celestine we were so happy. The staff offer the best service, we cannot fault at all. The hotel was beautiful. Clean, modern, elegant, warm and comfortable. Our room was everything we needed and more. Love the bathroom, the beds and the sofa beside the window overlooking Tokyo. It's a close walk to the train station and we always felt safe and close to everything we needed. The JR station is on the same line as Harajuku, Shibuya and Shinjuku which are the main areas to visit. As an English speaking traveler, it might have been nice to have some movie options on the TV but apart from that, we were very happy!

I revisited this hotel in August 2017 and stayed there for three nights--Sunday 3rd till Wednesday 6th.The hotel was undergoing renovation..it probably still is..so it is wise to check on this before you decide to stay there. Because of this check-in counter has been moved up to the 14th floor, where the lounge is situated. This is a little inconvenient since you will have to wait for the bus to/from Narita on the ground floor.Apart from that, much was the same as what I experienced before. Two details bothered me, however. First (and I am not sure if this was the case on my previous visits), I found it terribly inconvenient that the hotel does not provide complementary bottles of water in the room. One has to go to a dispenser located on another floor if one wants drinking water. This is quite a surprise since even Two Star hotels in small towns in many countries provide two bottles of drinking water each day, free of charge. Second, both in my room and at the restaurant where breakfast was served, there was green tea and other flavored teas but the simple English breakfast tea was no where to be found.I hope the management can address these little niggles and make the place more comfortable.

The staff were friendly, the room was nice and clean, English newspaper provided in the morning was appreciated. It is close to a number of things but it is more of a walk to a train station than some of the other hotels we stayed at. But once you're on the train it isn't long to get to wherever you want to go. It is a few minutes walk to a station. We would come back.

My wife and I stayed in this hotel for one night before heading to Haneda airport! Sad times...The hotel is very well kept and the lounge is a great place to chill before or after you head out into the madness. Our room had a fantastic view of Tokyo too.The hotel is easy access to Tokyo tower, Zojo-ji temple, the subway and other buzzy areas. A perfect place to stay that filled all our requirements.

We had two double rooms both with nice views of Tokyo. Good breakfast and lounge for coffee and tea. Three underground's within 5 minutes. Very calm neighborhood close to Tokyo tower. Very friendly staff.

This is a mid-range hotel nearby Tokyo tower and very close to the subway. The room size was a medium size (standard size in Tokyo). The room was a little bit old style (as they planned renovation this year) but stills have a nice equipment. The restaurant at the first floor was served a good food in the morning. Only one problem is the check-out line. As they do the payment system when you checking out, the line was very long when everyone check-out at the same time (11am). It is better to do payment during check-in or automatic payment after check-out. Otherwise, some peoples may miss their flight ...

An excellent hotel for business travel or otherwise. Centrally located - excellent property with a great facade and very welcoming lobby. The cafe in the ground floor offers wide range. Breakfast has both Japanese and Western choices. Rooms are spacious and very well furnished. Staff are very courteous ( no surprise there !!!). Will come back if I had a chance.

Gracious and helpful staff.Spacious (for Tokyo), quiet (the sound proofing was good) and tastefully decorated room. (My preference however, is for less furniture in the room. There was a small couch, a chair, and a table, in addition to the large bed.) Clean; looks well maintained. (Except for white deposits around sink faucets. Using a razor to scrape it off might get rid of it.) Generous toiletry selection and house slippers.Multiple clocks; easy to see at night.They even had a braille desk calendar!Pleasant and roomy guest lounge was stocked with beverages and cookies.Entry into the elevator is secured by hotel room card.Walking distance to a park with a stunning view of Tokyo Tower at night.Near (walking distance if not hauling luggage on a hot summer day) to several public transportation stations; Tamachi (JR) or Toei lines (closer). Cab fare to to nearby Hamamatsuchuo (Tokyo mono rail departure station) was under US$6.00.Currency exchange machine available in the lobby or at nearby banks near Tamachi station.Would stay here again. (Stayed in other hotels, hostels and ryokans in Japan. This was one of the nicer experiences.)

This hotel was chosen by me on various stays in Tokyo, because it is in walking distance to our headquarters. The hotel is close to some metro stations, however it needs a walk, which might be exhausting in hot and humid conditions like in summer time. The rooms are relatively small, but equipped with all you need and most important, they are clean. The breakfast is a good combination of Japanese and international dishes and impossible to leave in a hungry condition. The downside of this Hotel is the bar. It has an excellent choice of Whiskeys, a friendly Service, but is closed on several days including weekend.A good idea is the Cafeteria, a good place to hang around, reading a book or just communicate with other guests or friends / colleagues. Free coffee and tea is available and the atmosphere is nice.

This was our fourth visit to Tokyo and the third time we have stayed at the Celestine Hotel. The staff at all levels were always polite. Most spoke English and were really helpful in all respects. The location is excellent for our purposes, being very near Hamamatsucho JR station and very close to a Mita line underground station. It was also within easy walking range of The Zojoji Temple, Shiba Park and The Tokyo Tower. Our room had a comfortable twin bed of good size and the room size itself was good by Tokyo standards. A good range of toiletry accessories provided and replenished daily. In room complementary tea and coffee was provided and replenished daily. There is a Coffee and snack bar situated by the Reception area. Additionally, for residents, there is a comfortably relaxing lounge and roof garden on the 14th floor, which also provides complementary tea, coffee and biscuits on a 24 hour basis.. We have taken breakfast in the hotel on our previous visits and found it to be very satisfactory. However, there being a number of food outlets ranging from traditional Japanese to McDonald's between the Hotel and the aforementioned JR station, from which we travelled daily, we decided to eat out. All in all the hotel met all our requirements, though as a minor point, there was a charge for internet at the time we visited. Whatever, there is every likelihood we will be in Tokyo next year and will almost certainly wish again to stay at The Celestine Hotel.

Location is good, close to a couple of subway stations. Subway is fairly easy to navigate in Tokyo.Breakfast is quite good too.Staff are friendly and helpful.Rooms are nice but smallish. This is to be expected in Tokyo, though.

I have visited Tokyo several times and Celestine is the best affordable hotel in the city. Rooms are huge comparing to Tokyo standard. Breakfast is open buffet and European style breakfast is available.hotel is very close to Mita and Tamachi stations, good restaurants, a huge park, Tokyo tower is walking distance.

Hotel rooms meticulously clean, as well as all public areas. Service impeccable. Bathroom amenities include everything necessary, so you can walk in empty-handed. Breakfast includes both Asian and western choices. Very close to public transport.

Stayed 3 nights in a double room, really good size, excellent bathroom - one of the most comfortable beds I've slept in. Brilliant location - easy for subway and easy walk to Tokyo Tower and a lovely little park. We used it as a base & found it easy to get to Tsukiji (fish market), Roppongi Hills and Shibuya + Ginza districts.. kinda everything on the South West of the city center (Tokyo station also easy). We chose the location for those reason and also to be easy to Haneda Airport. Highly recommended. Had a nice outdoor area on the 14th floor.

This hotel is in a great location- round the corner from the mita subway (around 3 minute walk max) and 10 minute walk from Tamachi JR line. Lovely big lobby where you can enjoy a meal and/or drink (happy hour sparkling wine for ¥500 was lovely!). Staff welcoming and friendly. Rooms have wonderful big windows to see out across Tokyo and are a good size with big beds. We have stayed here before and would recommend a re-stay, however this time it wasnt all 100% perfect. Our room wasn't ready by check in time (though staff did apologise and hurried to resolve this), one of the lights in the bedroom didn't work, and the table in the bedroom was covered in a sticky residue. Other than a few little issues, the housekeeping was great and  problems were easily overlooked for the benefits of great location, lovely staff and wonderful views of the city.

My wife and I spent 2 nights last week in a deluxe double, king bed room and we thought the Celestine delivered excellent value and experience in every way. The room was clean, quiet, good size (apparently for Tokyo), in excellent condition and well looked after by the housekeeping staff. Service by everyone we encountered at the hotel was excellent. The wifi was great. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel. On the 14th Floor there is a very nice, comfortable lounge for hotel guests to enjoy complimentary coffee and tea 24 hours a day and it includes a nice outdoor seating area.Location was very good relative to central Tokyo and, as we preferred, in a quiet area at night. We flew into Haneda Airport and took one subway line directly to the Minato subway stop, which was a short walk to the hotel. Alternatively, it would have been a relatively short taxi ride....less than 15 miles.On a next visit to Tokyo we would certainly consider staying at the Celestine and would encourage others to consider it if they are seeking a very good, reasonably priced, understated, quiet, clean and well managed property in a very good location for exploring Tokyo.

New York City, New York

review_body: This was my first international trip and also my first trip alone and Celestine Hotel made it a great one. The employees are incredibly professional and helpful. The rooms are incredible with ridiculously awesome views. It's in a great area. Breakfast was also seriously awesome. Next time I'm in Tokyo, I'm staying here again.

A quite hotel away from all the busy of Tokyo. Especially after a day of going through sea of people at Metro stations, the famous Shinjuku and Shibuya.The hotel is nice and clean. The restaurant has variety of food and cakes. The staff are very polite and helpful.if you don't mind a few minutes walking from and to the station, then Celestine Hotel is the place with enough space to relax (rather than some shoe box hotel in the central location).

This hotel had everything we were looking for. The rooms are enough big for japanese standard, clean practical bathroom and amenities. We were in the 14° floor, where you have free access to a very big lounge (with free beverage & cookies 24 hrs) and a nice terrace with tables. The staff is friendly and helpful. The location is very good; only 5 minutes to the metro/train station (with good connections to everywhere). Absolutly recommended.

We were on a business and holiday trip and arrived from Kyoto via Shinagawa station. A short taxi ride and then we entered the large roomy hotel foyer and we suddenly felt relaxed in a different world. We had a very enjoyable lunch and received fantastic service from the staff and were ready to go exploring in Tokyo. Four minutes to Mita subway station and we were on our way. The Hotel is also a pleasant twenty minute walk north from Tokyo Tower. Stayed three days and loved the place and the Service.!!10 marks out of 10 for the staff for their Service!! We left a package of presents in a taxi on our way back to the airport and in desperation we rang the hotel for help. They tracked down the taxi driver and then through phone and emails they sent our parcel back to Australia, (well packaged up!) and we received it intact three days later - fantastic!

I chose to stay at this hotel as it was near to an event I needed to attend. It is a 4* hotel according to some literature and I wouldn't disagree. Very comfortable, especially as I was on my own, but if sharing with my husband it would still have been a great size room. Mini bar, ample power sockets, complimentary wifi, generous bath, wardrobe, nice bathroom amenities and I loved the face cleanser/moisture pack. All in all, what's not to like. Didn't eat at the hotel so can't comment on the restaurant nor breakfast. There is a Doutor Coffee nearby and convenience stores.

The Celestine hotel is located in the business district Tokyo, so it's quieter than the other districts, but still easy to get to the popular districts of Tokyo as the hotel is located only a couple of minutes away from the Mita subway station. Haneda airport is only thirty minutes away via the express train on the Asakusa line. The rooms are definitely bigger than most Tokyo hotel rooms and located on the top floors as the building also has offices. Staff were very friendly and accommodating - I left my iPad at the front desk during check-in and they were prompt to call the room when I got there. A great hotel in which I would choose to stay in again next time I'm in Tokyo!

We arrived after all day of traveling from the US and it was raining and at night. We were so glad to get to the Celestine! Honestly, my first thought was this place is off the beaten path because it was Saturday night and very quiet around the hotel, i.e not any bars/restaurants in plain view. It was not until the next day that I realized it's a 5-10 minute slow walk to the station and access to plenty of food/restaurants. In addition, it is in the Minato city which we didn't spend a lot of time in but great access to Ginza district, fish market, kabuki theater etc. So a very good location and you can still have a good nights rest. But if you want to go out at night and mix it up on the town, you may want to consider staying near Shinjuku or Shibuya stations.Staff was amazingly friendly. They have a gorgeous lounge free to all with coffee and tea. I believe it was open at all hours. They even warm up the coffee mugs in a heating drawer. Room sizes were consistent with Japan, i.e. tight quarters but no problem for the wife and I. They have bath robes in the room, great showers and hygiene supplies and free coffee and tea. I like it when a hotel does not nickle and dime you! There is also a 7/11 on the premises which is great. The desk gave us vouchers which gave us the morning buffet at a cost of $23 which was a little more than I was willing to pay for the 5 days we stayed. So we ate 2x there and food was good mix of Japanese and Western-lite options.

Celestine Hotel could easily become my favorite hotel in Tokyo. The room was very comfortable and felt slightly larger than some other hotels where I've stayed during past visits. The breakfast buffet offered good choices. The staff was friendly and efficient. For those who are looking for coffee, there is a Tully's in the same building. The hotel is a reasonable walk from Mita and Tamachi stations.

This business hotel is located in Minato closest metro station Mita. Lots of corporations based in the area.Very good base to move around city. Great connections to airports Narita and Haneda.Hotel is nice, great lobby and one lounge with free drinks If you want to have a casual meeting or relax outside your room. Very friendly staff Nice walks around If you need to breath some fresh air, including the tokio tower.

The taxi driver told us that we were staying at the best hotel in the area when we arrived. He was right! The hotel is well located; the service and amenities at the hotel were just excellent. We consulted the front desk about our travel plans every day and they were very knowledgeable and helpful. They were very attentive and spoke elegant Englisih. There is a lounge and a beautiful courtyard on a higher floor (14th floor? Check with the front desk) where you can relax and have a cup of coffee or tea. The breakfast was delicious--both western and Japanese styles. It's safe and easy to walk around.

This hotel had everything i expected. Reasonable size room, clean practical bathroom which dried quickly after use. Free toiletries. Quiet. Lovely, helpful staff. Easy access to subway and JR trains- so convenient! Not many English options on tv, but i didn't purchase the extra movie options. I would definitely stay here again. Close to Tokyo tower, but i didn't have a view of this.

Stayed here for a week. The location is quite convenient, with two stations nearby - one subway, one JR train line. You can reach the hotel with direct train line from Haneda airport. It takes less than 30 min. Staff at front staff speaks some English. Hotel is at the top 3 level of the high rise, with a lounge at level 14 that is open to all guests stay at the hotel. Quite many local restaurants near the train station. We tried to find a place on Friday night, and experienced the Japanese culture of after-work dinner - took us a while to find a Korean restaurant to sit us. You may want to check with the front desk staff where your room is located when you check in. Ours were completely on the other side of the building to where the elevators are located. so it always takes us a bit walk to get to our room.

The best way to get to the hotel from Narita is by Train. Take the Narita express to shinagawa station and then I took a cab. Very easy. Breakfast not so good. Great bar but expensive. Rooms wile not big on USA terms but had everything you needed. Good work center with free coffee and water and access to outdoors.

I have been meaning to write about the Celestine Hotel for quite a while.I stayed there exactly 1 year ago - for a week. March 2016. The rooms are very clean, nice & good size. The hotel not only gives you toiletries but you'll also find PJs on the bed. If you like to run, it's right by Shiba park - so you won't have far to go to Run. It's also right by Tokyo Tower. Staff is great, friendly and helpful.

New York City, New York

review_body: Very happy with the services of this hotel. We were there with the whole family, including my parents and in-laws in November 2015 for one week family vacation. Naturally, we wanted our rooms to be on the same floor. They were able to cater to our request and we were delighted, except that my room that gave me, though quite large for a hotel in Tokyo, did not have any view at all as it was facing hotel grounds. So, we made a request to change room with a view of the city skyline. That day was Sunday, and all the rooms were fully occupied, but they told us to pack our belongings when we return to the room that night and they would happily transfer our luggage to another room with a view as soon as it becomes available the following day when we are out sightseeing. They were true to their words. No surcharge or anything. They also had a cozy lounge area serving cookies and hot drinks,

We came here after staying at the Radisson and this hotel is just with default. The staff go out of their way to help and the rooms whilst small are well equipped. This is a wonderful place to stay highly recommended.

A local Japanese friend recommended the Celestine that we had not heard of but we were looking for something not too expensive and convenient. We found our needs fulfilled with much more than we expected. The hotel room we had was very comfortable with a nice view with all the amenities we were used to in other well known hotels we stayed in. The breakfast buffet was also very nice and more than adequate. An unusual extra was a lounge open 24 hours on an upper floor where one could have a tea or coffee, read a magazine or newspaper and also meet with friends instead of crowding into one's room. The area also offers many tourist and dining attractions in waling distance and subway lines a few steps away. Also convenient is a stop at the hotel of the airport Limousine Bus making one's airport transfer to Narita faster and less costly.

I stayed for a week. I had a room with a double bed. The room was big enough to move around in, with space for me to open my suitcase and leave it on a luggage stand. There's a little coffee table and a small desk. It's pretty-good sized for a Japanese hotel.Access to the subway is nice -- it's less than five minutes to the Mita station on the Toei Mita and Toei Asakusa lines . Tamachi station on the JR Yamanote line is about nine minute's walk.The hotel public spaces are very clean and nice. Rooms are also modern-feeling and very clean. I did not eat at the restaurant, but the lobby cafe serves a nice breakfast for around $10. There is a very pleasant lounge space on the 14th floor where guests can hang out and enjoy free coffee/tea/snacks.The room rate was similar to other business hotels I have stayed in, but the class of hotel was a notch above. It's an excellent value.

Few months ago traveled to Tokoyo and selected Celestine Hotel on a colleague recommendations. It was an excellent trip and stay. Hotel location was great, few steps away from NEC super tower. All food places were easily accessible. Morning view from Hotel room window was awesome. Hotel business center is equipped with latest communication tools to provide seamless connectivity all over the world.

Stayed here in August. Flight arrived in the morning made my way on my own using the airport shuttle from Haneda. Room was not ready but staff took my case so I was able to go and see the local area. Walked to the Tokyo Tower. Mita subway line is around the corner as well as Tamachi station on the JR Yamanote Line. The easiest way to travel is to get a Pasmo or Suica card where you top up and pay as you go. Hotel room was on the 17th floor with views of the city. The room size was fine for me but anyone taller and larger might think it's a little small. Great hotel, convenience stores nearby. Recommend this for anyone who doesn't need to be in the main centre, area was quiet, mainly businesses in the area.

I have stayed in this hotel many times. The service and the quality is very dependable. There area has many restaurants scudding Japanese, Korean, Chinese, Spanish, Italian. So you will not go hungry. The rooms re a good size and the internet is very fast and free. The buffet breakfast has a large selection from Japanese to Western.

I have stayed at the Celestine 3 times and each time I have not been let down. The location is a big standout for this property. Can walk to Tokyo tower or Ginza in about 15-25 minutes where you can find a lot of choices for dining or shopping (easy to hop the train, but walking Tokyo is more fun). Staff for the most part is friendly and helpful however some lack experience when arranging transportation to the airport. The in house bar and restaurant is not open on the weekends which is actually a shame as the bar is actually very nice with an excellent selection of Japanese Whisky (Fortunately the minibar in the room is possible one of the best stocked minibars I have ever seen). Rooms are in various sizes but bed quality is good and over all the rooms are comfortable and well insulated from outdoor sound. Over all the hotel is nice, elevator is fast and location is pretty good.

I chose the Celestine Hotel after a little bit of research online, just because i wanted to break away from the more familiar (and more convenient) Shinagawa area. i'm very happy i did. after a short 1900 yen taxi ride from Tokyo's main train station i was greeted warmly by the hotel's staff and spent a great first night in a quiet room on the 17th floor. room size was just right for one person. the next morning, in the breakfast room i noticed several other business travellers had made the same decision to stay here. breakfast items were many and varied to suit all tastes. i have yet to explore the area on foot, but it appears to be sufficiently interesting. i can see Tokyo Tower from my hotel room window, just a few blocks away. Unless you crave being right in the centre of all the action of Tokyo, i can't see why you wouldn't be happy at the Celestine.

As you would expect rooms are 'cosy' but comfortable. Resident lounge on 14th floor very useful for meetings and if you have time after check out and before travel.Staff were very helpful - especially when my husband realised he had left his phone in the taxi we arrived in - by the time we had eaten lunch they had been in touch with the taxi company and the phone was safely returned. Many thanks!

my main issue with them was the presence of mold in the shower and tub. hotel lacks any sort of fitness center or pool. expensive on every aspect. Beds were firm, pillows were not comfortable. the only plus side was the close distance to 2 metro lines. I would not stay at that hotel again.

I was expecting a decent business hotel (like a 3-star), and it turned out to be a pleasantly upscale hotel (like a 4-star). The lobby is light, airy, and inviting, and my room on the 17th floor was surprisingly spacious for a single. Rooms in Japan can be very small but this one was plenty spacious for one person. The bed was the size of a small double and very comfortable, everything was in good shape, there was sufficient storage, and in the morning, there was a newspaper. Even though I'd booked the room just for one person, there were two shower towels, hand towels etc. Small touches like that make a hotel more than just satisfactory--you feel like they care about their guests and put thought into giving them a good experience. My view was great, it was very quiet, and the free wifi worked reliably. I only had breakfast at the hotel, no other meals, and I recommend the breakfast plate at the Rayon Vert cafe in the lobby. It's good value and good quality with free coffee refills.As to drawbacks, the breakfast buffet at the hotel restaurant (Grand Cross, I think) was not impressive with limited selection of mediocre food, and the space seemed cold and impersonal. It's twice the price of the breakfast plate at the much nicer Rayon Vert, so I mostly chose the latter (breakfast was not included in my rate). The only other slight drawback was the location: there was not much immediately in the vicinity of the hotel but a 5-minute walk to the west takes you to a major road with lots of restaurants. There are also several restaurants (including a very nice sushi place) near Mita Station. The hotel is about a four-minute walk from exit 10 of Mita Station, so it's easy to get to anywhere in Tokyo.I enjoyed my stay at Celestine, and I wouldn't mind returning.

I stayed at the Celestine in September 2016 for 9 days. The room was very clean and modern except it was very small. The staff were helpful and professional. It was close to public transportation and there was a convenience store a very short distance away. I would recommend staying in a larger room if you plan on staying more than a few days.

Top hotel for a reasonable price on a top location in Miniato/Tokyo. Central for both business as touristic occasions. Nice bars and restaurants on walking distance. Rooms are on top floors of building with astonishing views over the city.

The hotel lies in a fairly quiet yet accessible area of Tokyo and with floors being on 14-17th floors, you get good views of Tokyo's skyline whichever way your room faces. Rooms feel new and nicely furbished however not very big, but then again it's Tokyo. Open roof terrace is a nice extra, although would have been nice to be able to get drinks up there (other than tea & water). Handy direct connection to Narita Airport from nearest station (8-10 mins walk).

The location of the hotel is quiet. There is a nice lounge on the 14th floor.The bgeakfast buffet offers a wide varaity of choices and is very tasty.The internet connection was fast and availble in all rooms.

My husband and I chose this hotel for our very first trip to Japan. The location seemed to be good, but it was a bit further from the rail station than we would have liked - probably a 5 minute walk. The hotel itself was very nice and we felt a little under dressed when we arrive, but the price was just right for our two weeks in Japan. The amenities are also nice; they provide q-tips, two disposable plastic brushes, toothbrushes with tiny tubes of toothpaste, ponytail hair bands, a face product sampler trio, body cloth, and shower cap. Every morning they would deliver a newspaper to your door and restock your bathroom toiletries when you are away/request for room cleanings. The room itself was a little small, but comfortable to sleep in - it. We did not have any issues with noise other than the traffic on the street, which was not bad at all. The area felt relatively safe and there were streets with various restaurants to try. We would always go to the 7-Eleven a few blocks down to pick up "breakfast" and go back to the hotel's garden area to eat. Overall, we had a really good experience at the Celestine and would not mind going back again!

As always when you choose a hotel, think about what your need is? Cozy boutique hotel or a streamlined chain hotel? Is it OK for you to use taxi/metro, or do you want to live in the middle of everything, and what is “everything” for you?The Celestine is a clean and efficient hotel. Will work as a business as well as for tourists. I found it perfect for my 3 days sightseeing Tokyo.Location:Upper Minato. 6 minutes walk fra Tamachi station with is on Yamanote Line (Central line) this is an huge advantage! You can also find Mita station around the corner.Very quite area (business district) and to many restaurants around, so be prepared to take the metro a station or two. (Obviously they are plenty of small places around the Tamachi station) but this is not an area to go bananas with good and different restuarants.5 minute walk to Tokyo Tower (looks better from a distance, but I dropped by one night, very pricy).Room:Fresh and relatively new. You are provided with all the small things that will make your life a little easier. The room was high on the 17.th floor. Panorama window over Tokyo was perfect and really added value for me. Not to modern, room but good and clean enough. The bath was very small and all plastic. Felt very cheap. (not dirty or very old, just plastic).I’ve seen some comments about the size. I think this is very standard business size rooms (maybe bath a bit smaller). But this is not a Vegas style family room or hotel.Service:Very nice staff!There and back again:Take the airport express to any station on Yamanote line or Akasua (?) Line, then to Tamachi or Mita station, and take a walk from there. With heavy baggage, a Taxi from Tokyo Central could be a better option.Value:I found this to be a very good value hotel. If you need a huge fitness room and pool, and full restaurant room service 24h, I think you need to go up a star.Would I go back?Yes, I would easy stay here again.

Stayed for just one night - central to business district and Tokyo tower. Very small rooms with lousy air conditioning.Property badly needs a renovation - service was really good and breakfast was adequate.

Stayed here for just under two weeks with work.Room was a little small but had everything you would need: hairdryer, safe, fridge, hair and beauty accessories etcBoth air conditioning units worked well, which was good as it was so hot while we were there.The hotel itself is a little bit isolated, with not much around. It is close to the subway which is the cheapest way to get to downtown. There is a little shop in the hotel compound and a few restaurants sharing the building.The main hotel restaurant is pretty expensive and for some reason not open at weekends?! Also, the bar only stays open until 10.30pm and is also expensive.The cafe area is in the lobby and a good place to relax with free wifi and snacks, but again a little pricey. There is a terrace area on floor 14 that offers free tea, coffee and biscuits with a computer and printer area that you can pay to use.

The hotel is conveniently located at Mita Subway Station which on reflection is very useful as from this station you have access to the city of Tokyo and beyond. Rooms are small and can be a little claustrophobic, we had a double room and two people could not live in this room all day! Breakfast is adequate, more local than international and a limited selection of pastries and no egg station. Staff are very professional and friendly. In my opinion it is a business hotel, does not cater well to tourists, the 14th floor lounge is a nice area, a bonus to chill out and drink a coffee/tea/water

I stayed their for 5 nights Staff is extremely helpful, Nice breakfast, an Egg Station could add more points, clean rooms and nice service, minutes walk from Mita Station, Tokyo Station is 15 min by cab, they have a 7/11 shop right behind the hotel. Will definitely recommend others to stay here. Thank you

This is a modern occidental style hotel. The best thing about it is the attention they paid to sound isolation. You'll truly spend a quiet night. The rooms are OK for western standards and quite spacious for what is current in Japan. The double beds are not very large but comfortable even for tall persons. You can make your own coffee and tea in your room. The batroom and toilet are clean and modern but not very spacious. Breakfast is buffet-style. Though westerners will find what they need to have a decent breakfast, I found the buffet to be lacking in care (some of the fruit was frozen, for example). The hotel's clients seem to be principally people there on business.

We stayed at the Celestine Hotel for 9 days. Our first visit to Tokyo so we spent a lot of time trying to find the right hotel - as Tokyo is so big and there are many places to see and things to do.Location - Minato-ku (where the hotel is located) is in a financial area and so it's extremely quiet at night which is fantastic after being in the crowds all day. We arrived in from Kyoto by Shinkansen so came straight into Tokyo station. When you arrive at Tokyo station, jump on the JR Yamanote Line towards Shibuya/Shinjuku and get off at Tamachi. It's then about a 1km (6min) walk to the hotel (which you can do underground via the Mita subway line (exit 8 or 10), or on street level. When you want to travel to other areas of Tokyo that are not close to the Yamanote loop line, there is the Mita subway line as well as the Asakusa subway line within walking distance of the hotel that you can also use. We used these lines to get to the Skytree and to other districts for convenience during our stay.The hotel itself is close to a number of restaurants, the Tokyo tower and also Roppongi. Roppongi is about a 2.5km walk from the hotel and has lots of attractions, bars, restaurants and museums. It's not easy to access via train, so we recommend walking. Tokyo station and Ginza area are also about 3-4kms away, so relatively close.We used our JR pass to use the JR trains (mostly the Yamanote loop line as it was most convenient), and had our ICOCA (IC) card which we purchased in Kyoto and could be used for all JR and subway private lines (and restaurants/convenience stores) that accept SUICA cards (Tokyo equivalent card).Hotel amenities24 hour reception which was good as we had to check out before dawn.Clean room, quiet and spacious for TokyoWe stayed in a standard double (had a queen room) overlooking the city (14th floor), decent bathroom with standard extras, toto toilet and a nice addition is the Japanese beauty sample set. Hotel has free wifi, a lounge that is open to guests 24hrs a day with coffee, tea, water, magazines, computer on level 14. Also two outdoor large patio areas where you can enjoy your beverages.Hotel is in a business building (separate entrance) so starts at level 14. The lobby area has a cafe and there is also a bar and restaurant - we didn't visit these as there were many other options to choose from. The room has two mini bars (fridge and dry products) and a small cupboard with hanging facilities. Only disappointment (and we didn't realise how convenient this was until we started our trip), but being a more upmarket hotel, it doesn't offer self service laundry facilities - only a paid service. This would have been nice to have as we travelled in the middle of summer which made it hard to keep clothes clean for long.Overall, we're very glad we chose this hotel. If you want somewhere to come back to somewhere that's quiet, spacious and away from the crowds, this hotel is for you. If you'd prefer to be in a party/busy district, suggest you choose somewhere else. Tips for guests1. Getting to the airportThe trains start running from Tamachi station at 5am. The first fast train (Keisei private) to Narita airport leaves at 5.58am on weekdays from Ueno and takes 41 minutes. Stops at terminals (2-3) first and then Terminal 1 last. Strongly suggest doing a test run to the Keisei station and buy your tickets in advance so you know where you are going on the day. fastest way is to take the JR Yamanote line towards Tokyo and get off at Ueno. You then need to take the Shibuzan exit from the station and walk to the Keisei station (across the road). There you can catch the airport express.2. Cost of travel on subway and trains.Using your prepaid JR pass is free on Jrtrains, you just need to show it to the station officer at the gates when you come and go.Using the IC card, it cost approximately 130 - 160 to travel on the Yamanote Line and also switching between JR and subway lines.The IC card can be used on both JR and private lines. 3. Getting money outSeven Eleven ATMs are the best and most convenient for taking money out. You need to put your card in before you can choose your language.4. Visiting the Tokyo SkytreeIf you are an international visitor to Japan, you can access the fast track lane to the tower. When you find the desk,they will give you all the instructions. It's about 600 yen more expensive than the normal ticket,but TOTALLY WORTH IT. The normal ticketing system is timed so you may have to wait till your time slot depending on how busy it is on the day. We didn't have to wait long at all and were ushered up straight away. It is a very popular attraction.Things to see and do (highly recommended)Ippudo ramen (various locations)Akihabara (electric town) - on the Yamanote lineGhibli exhibition in Roppongi HillsDay trip to Yokahama (visit the cupnoodles museum and ramen museum and the Nissan headquarters)Ueno park and the Tokyo National MuseumThe imperial palace gardensDominique Ansel Bakery

The hotel location is great! A great and spacious hotel and hotel rooms for a very reasonable price in Tokyo. The room comes with great and complete amenities with comfortable mattress. A lounge with a garden courtyard with free coffee for all staying guests is provided. The airport limousine bus stops at the hotel for easy Narita airport transfer. Mita metro station & JR Tamachi station is nearby. The hotel is also nearby Shiba Park and Tokyo Tower. The staff were awesome and extremely pleasant, friendly and helpful - managed to changed our room to a stunning Mount Fuji view without any hassle. Our other three rooms were facing Tokyo Bay/Odaiba.

We have stayed there twice and it's a good hotel and well located. There is a breakfast that is worth going for and a guest lounge. Our room was on the 14th floor on both occasions. The conceirge service is good and the hotel is close to Haneda airport.

Hotel is located conveniently near to my office so it's a good option for me to stay here on business trip. There is airport shuttle to this hotel and it's an option if you are not too tired for the long ride. Room is quiet, clean and comfortable and has all the required amenities. Good variety of both Japanese and western food at breakfast buffet. Friendly and helpful staff who speak English. The only disappointment is that room service ends at 11pm. I got in on a late flight and only arrived at my hotel room at 11.15pm. There was no other option at the hotel as the 7-11 outlet is closed on weekend.

It's a well furnished hotel. Very well trained staff at the counter and concierge. Helpful advise given ok travel tips and very friendly in terms of helping to arrange travel and reservation. Service is very high standard and personal. Very good value for money. Sited In a quiet area, not much activities going on in surrounding areas, but easy access to all place is interests as it sit on multiple train lines. The only drawback is the size of the room, but it has everything you need with a reasonable price, so nothing to complain.

Stayed 3 nights at Celestine. Room was small (to be expected in Tokyo) but comfortable and clean. Convenient location to subway and JR, and easy to get to Haneda airport. Otherwise, there's not much around in this neighborhood, and we couldn't even find restaurants nearby open on Sunday evening.

The strengths of the hotel include its friendly staff, clean rooms and its convenient connection to Narita via a limousine bus. The best feature was a club lounge located on a higher floor (I cannot recall which floor) that was open 24 hours and offered complimentary coffee and cookies. This was an useful place to meet colleagues informally, after meetings. It offered a pleasant place to relax outside of your rather small room.The other advantage is that it is a short walk away from Tokyo Tower and a few ancient shrines, if you are into these things. I found that walking to these places was a pleasant form of relaxation after a long day of meetings.The main disadvantages are that the rooms are quite small and there are no Western style eating places nearby. There is a small convenience store across the street at the back of the hotel but it sells mostly buns and packed Japanese style foods that require to be warmed before eating.The breakfast spread is quite generous although, like in Seoul, there was no egg-station freshly preparing eggs to your specification. This I found to be a major-let down for a hotel of this stature.Overall, I had a pleasant stay ..

Delighted to make this last minute booking for 3 nights. 10 minute walk to Tokyo tower and close by metro to Midtown, I loved the elegant reception and friendly staff. The room was comfortable with lovely extras such as the coffee lounge, well equipped bathroom and generous breakfast. With all the rooms 14 floors upwards there are great views. I also appreciated the flowers on the doors, the international newspaper and the bird songs in the corridor. Perfect for both tourists and business travelers.

Well decorated hotel. Hotel stuffs are really cordial. i really liked the verity of breakfast served everyday. It takes approximately 8 min walk to find the traditional Japanese restaurant. very quiet place. very close to mita station and 10 min walk to tamachi station. Rooms are little small but very much clean. there are open Terrace with lots of trees and small plants. you can sometime enjoy you time there.Recommended for the business traveler mostly.

Good location, clean rooms and helpful staff. It is nothing special but it is perfect if you are in Tokyo for just a weekend and will not spend too much time at the hotel. Both the train station and the subway are located 5 minutes away and you could easily walk to Tokyo Tower. Big breakfast buffet with lots of options. Food is good but it will not blow your mind or surprise you. We got one of the little bit bigger rooms with a view. Rooms are not very big so this was probably a good choice.

We will definitely be going back here! The cocktail waitress was amaze balls! Her Expresso Martini was the best I've tasted and she has skills with the shaker!!! The hotel room had some nice touches including magazines, water and a chocolate on the pillow! The owners greeted us personally in the morning with a coffee, bacon roll and a smileThe facilities were clean and decor was stylish! We loved eating breakfast on the sunny terrace and the owners were delightful to talk too. This was a five star stay and will be returning as soon as they allow us too well done celestines!

Room sizes are always a concern in Tokyo but this hotel has some very nicely proportioned rooms and that includes a large bathroom as well. The staff are extremely friendly and engaging. For myself speaking English with the front desk when I needed something never presented a problem. The buffet breakfast has a large variety of both Japanese, Asian and Western choices. Only negatives are no gym and some rooms are a long walk from the elevator bank which for myself was not a problem but for those that have mobility issues be sure to ask for one nearby.

We knew nothing about Tokyo and this was the first place we stayed, booking it off the internet. Proved to be reasonably priced, centrally located and very friendly. Easy to get ticket for shuttle from NRT to the door of hotel. Just line up at he ticket desk and the staff will make sure you do not get lost. No complaints.

This hotel is in a good location, a reasonable taxi ride from Haneda or Tokyo Station. It is also very convenient to the metro. The rooms are good-sized and clean. The breakfast is fine, with plenty of choices. There are not any restaurants within walking distance and the staff is not very helpful in finding places to eat so this is a good place to stay if you are already familiar with Tokyo and have your own favorite restaurants. Except for the Japanese toilet, I felt that this hotel could have been anywhere in the world.

For our first time im Tokyo, we found this hotel very good from the description on the internet and decided to give it a try. It was not the cheapest, but at least the rooms doesn't seem too small (compare my review of the Hong Kong stay at "Loi Loi Guesthouse").When we arrived, the room was not yet ready, but that's because we arrived way earlier than the "check-in" time.After a quick lunch in the restaurant in the hotel, our room was ready and we could get up.It's was spotless clean and very nice. We also received some vouchers giving us discounts for the breakfast (I will come back to this later).The whole staff was very nice and really helpful. Every question was answered with a smile.They have a lounge on the 14th floor, giving space to chill with free coffee (good coffee!), tea and water. This lounge has 2 outside seating areas, 1 for smokers and 1 for non-smokers.We found the location very convenient. Some 5 minutes walk to Mita and Shibakoen, some 10 minutes walk to Akabanebashi. 15 minuntes walk brings you to the area of Damion, with lots of restaurants.The shiba park is just just there and the Tokyo Tower can be reached by a 20 minutes walk.As mentioned above, we received some vouchers for discounts on the breakfast buffet. I was actually good, but I would consider even the discounted price too expensive for what they offer. But that's us and in comparison with the food generally you can get around Tokyo.The Rayon Vert Restaurant at the lobby was fantastic. The price is also right and the food was very tasty. We also visit the bar to get some of the famous Japanese Whiskey. The bartender was very helpful in explaining the differences and so we ended up tasting a couple of them. This was also a nice way to let the day pass and get ready for a good nights sleep.When we left, we ordered an airport shuttle with the hotel. The staff from the lobby was very helpful, organizing everything and talked to the driver. They even served some cereal bars and coffee for the waiting time. Before be went on the bus, they asked us which airline and told us exactly, where to exit the bus (second stop).When visiting Tokyo again, this would be our hotel of choice.

Close to the Mita station (4 mins walk) and only 30mins from the Haneda airport. Larger rooms than you would expect from a Japanese hotel. A quiet area, which I appreciate. The included breakfast is a good blend of Western and Japanese food.There are fancier hotels, which I have tried, but I come back here.My only suggestion would be to include a gym...we road warriors would appreciate it.

This is a businesslike hotel where everything is clean, new and well maintained. Our room was not large but still had a reasonable size, we had an amazing city view and it was very quiet. A nice feature about this hotel is on its 14th floor: a beautiful room with armchairs, sofas, complimentary espresso coffee, biscuits, cold water and a very pleasant outdoor area. In terms of location, the hotel is in a quiet business area, not far from a park and there are plenty of small restaurants in the neighbourhood. Another bonus is that you can walk to Tamachi JR train station in less than 15 minutes and to Mita subway station in 7. Airport transfer (Narita): the hotel offers a shuttle service which takes as long as the Narita Express and costs about the same. A cheaper option is to use the regular JR train but it takes 30 minutes longer and services are not as frequent, so make sure you check the timetable. Hotel staff was very nice and they honored all the requests we made when booking.

First I knew it was in a business district which meant it was quiet at night which in my book is a plus, we booked a corner room which for Japan and most other places around the world was a huge room 45 sq mtrs, obviously we paid extra for this, but what a joy not to have to squeeze past each other or our suitcases.  Its a 4 minuet walk from Mita station(exit A8 has a lift and A10 has an escalator) which is on the direct Keikyu line from Haneda airport ( we brought the 72 hour welcome card from the Keikyu information kiosk next to the station at the airport with the return trip on the Keikyu line. The Keikyu line train back to airport leaves from the Asakusa line platforms not every train goes to the airport but one leaves about every twelve minuets. The hotel is also a 2 minuet walk to Shibakoen station on the Toei line. Our room had a window nearly the entire length of one wall and a small one on the corner, there was another window in the bathroom above the sink which look directly into a close by office blocks canteen so we didn't open the blind on this one. The view from the main window was of a city scape not to far reaching as there are a large number of higher building about and we were on the 15th floor or though you could climpse the sea between the buildings, there are 2 higher floors so their views might have been better, I don't know but the views from the other side of the hotel might have been better. The room was in good condition except for a couple of small stains on the sofa and 3 cracked floor tiles in the wet room. The shower was very good and the bath was a deep one, I'm 6ft so for me having the raised seat in the bath made for a not to relaxing experience but it didn't bother my 5'2" wife. Every bathroom item you could desire was there including bath salts a long with a separate toilet. The room was cleaned to a high standard every day and I love that each time we have stayed in Japan PJ's have been supplied, the ones supplied here were longer than any I've had in the past, they are just ideal for relaxing around the room when your just chilling, bathrobes and slippers were supplied to but I never use the bathrobes in any hotel just because I never use one at home I guess. The area around the hotel is a business district but there are 'Lawson' and 'Eleven' convenience stores all around with a lot of restaurants of different types in the streets behind Mita station and if you walk towards Hamamatsucho JR station (where the monorail stops from Haneda) you'll pass many restaurants and if you really need a MacDonalds or a Starbucks or a Mos burger you'll find them to also just roud the corner from the hotel is a place called Jonathan's which from the outside doesn't look to appealing but its modern light and clean with a mix of Japanese and European foods. Try the Bracken starch pudding (yes made from the roots of the bracken weed) its different or even the snow crab and fresh seaweed salad, its not always Sushi, ramen or Soba. There is a good BBQ place other side of JR Tamachi station (convenient for the Yamanote loop line) on the 4th floor of one of the building as you come back down to street level. All the staff at the hotel were charming and very polite which of coarse is the way in Japan. The lounge on the 14th floor was relaxing with free hot drinks and also a computer with printer for printing out those pesky boarding cards, there's another computer in the lobby area as well. Would I stay again, you bet I would.

I stayed at this good hotel for eight days. It is a centrally located nice property accessible easily by walk from the Mita as also Tamachi stations. The room on 14th floor was clean and decent. The hotel has a lounge facility, for the staying guests, with free coffee and tea. The linen, toilets were extremely clean in every sense of the term. The staff was very cooperative right from the day I checked to the check out time. The restaurants are good. Breakfast at the restaurant has very good spread. I could easily find seating on all mornings, unlike my earlier stays in hotels in Japan. Both check-in and check out were done in under two minutes' time ! There are convenience stores ( Lawsons' ) close by.

Don’t look for nightlife around…. But the Celestine is located in quiet business neighborhood very close to subway station.You need to walk less than 5 min to reach the TOEI line. You can stop at Mita or Tamachi, the walking time is identical.Rooms are small, like anywhere in japan but very clean and modern. The view is great as the rooms starts from the 14th floor.A nice, cozy 24hr free coffee and tee lounge bar is available.The price we got was a great deal considering the room, the hotel and the location. I would definitively consider staying again

The Celestine is located in a business district which made it very quiet at night. It was a short 5min walk to 2 nearby train stations- JR at Tamachi, and Mita. It's a lengthy walk to get to the train platforms but pleasant because of the cool weather.Rooms were very clean and with toiletries and amenities that were promptly replenished daily, and there was 24hr coffee available at the very nice and spacious lounge! Breakfast was available in the lobby lounge for around $10, and also for double that amount at the Buffet located down the hallway across the lobby lounge.For the price and cleanliness, I would consider staying here again. The only hiccup was the mixup caused by staff at the front desk, who booked our massage at a certain time, and failed to inform us that the attendant was busy with another guest who had extended

This was our third visit to Tokyo and the first time to stay in this area. Location is good, more residential and quieter at night but an easy place to find your way around from. We mostly used the JR line from Tamachi Station which is less than a 10 minute walk away and has a direct line to key areas like Harajuku, Shinjuku and Shibuya. It was kind of nice to stay out of the more crowed parts. It's walking distance from the hotel to Tokyo Tower and Ueno Park is also in the vicinity.The hotel itself is very modern, the rooms are small but very nice and spotlessly clean. Ours had the added bonus of a great city view. There's a lovely communal room which provides free tea and coffee throughout the day. We did not have an opportunity to try the hotel restaurant but the lobby cafe/bar looked good and was also busy. There's an airport bus which stops at the hotel and goes back to Narita Airport which was useful. Staff were very friendly and professional. I'd stay here again!There did not appear to be may restaurants close by which were open at night but we did find this great little burger place called Munches Burger Shack on the first night, just 5 minutes walk from the hotel. Great beers and burgers but it also closed by 9pm.

We stayed 7 nights at the Celestine. It was clean, modern and convenient to both the Mita Station and the Tamachi Station. The front desk crew are very helpful and courteous. When we found ourselves unsure which train to take on our daily explorations, they would go out of their way to help direct us and even wrote down the directions. There is a guest lounge on one floor that provides cold water, tea and espresso or coffee and good cookies. An English language paper was delivered everyday. Room TV has a few English language channels. Out the front door and 2 blocks to the right, and then another right takes you into a quiet little restaurant district and past that is a full service grocery store. Wi-fi was free. Overall, we were very happy with the Celestine and would recommend it to anyone staying in Tokyo.

My husband and I stayed at the Celestine Hotel for three nights in March. The ‘superior double’ room was clean, comfortable and not overly cramped. The room included drip coffee, unlike many hotels. The staff was friendly. We enjoyed the Rayon Vert café in the Lobby on multiple occasions, and found good neighborhood restaurants nearby as well. Our favorite amenity was the upper floor lounge. The library setting was inviting and relaxing, and the coffee machine and biscuits were delicious – an excellent respite. We highly recommend this hotel!

Booked a superior double room & still felt it may have been small by usual room standards. However, it fit the 2 of us with 2 opened luggages. Everything was clean. Free coffee and tea in room & in the lounge so that was helpful. Vending machine on our floor so it was easy to grab some drinks (then again vending machines are all over Japan). Sky access express is a direct train from Narita Terminal 1 to Asakusa Line (Mita stop). However, exit from the Mita station (blue line) A10 exit and you'll find yourself 2 blocks away from the hotel. JR Tamachi is also about 10 minutes using the back streets. That area has many restaurants all around it.

We stayed at the Celestine Hotel for five days at the end of March 2016 and the beginning of April. On arrival our first impressions were good. The lobby was spacious and airy. The reception staff were well-presented and professional. The room could have been bigger but size must be an expensive luxury in Tokyo. At least it was clean and well-tended. By the way, thanks for the Mikimoto cream! The restaurant staff, the cleaning ladies and the rest of the employees were always polite. One advantage of the Celestine is its closeness to Mita station. I would not hesitate to stay in this hotel again.

I stayed here for 4 nights and was put up in two single bed rooms. The room was very spacious for one person. The view is not that great. It is of some buildings around and is not very pretty. this is located right in the middle of a lot of office buildings. There are absolutely no restaurants whatsoever around the area. Mita station is closeby but is quite a walk for Asakusa line.
