review_body: Overall a pleasant stay. Pleanty of room and a very comfortable bed for our 5 days in Tokyo. Location was convenient. I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again. The closest station is the Mita stop on the Mita line. 15 minute walk to the Tokyo tower.

I stayed at Celestine for 1 week, true the size of the room is quite small. But again, it's common for Japanese hotel. We manage to cosleep with my 6yo in one bed.. I love the neighborhood because it's quite, yet it has all the basic needs. 7-11 convinient store is at the back of the hotel lobby, then Lawson is only 2 minutes away, Tullys coffee also steps away from lobby.I honestly prefer to stay in this area than Shinjuku , too busy at night for me.The staffs are very friendly during check in, they speak adequate English and the check in was fast. Their free wifi also good. Around 7 minutes walking from hotel is the Mita Station (metro) and 12-15 minutes walk from hotel is a JR station - Tamachi, which both make all the trip to explore Tokyo easy. You might take a little time to learn about the map of JR and Metro since they are very extensive lines But practically u can go anywhere in Tokyo thru those trains. Love itEateries can be found around 5-7 minutes walk from hotel, they have good choices from ramen to Japanese BBQ, we had a good experience since we love Japanese food. Never had a bad experience with food in Tokyo, literally. So overall, I recommend this hotel and would love to go back there again when I visit Tokyo.

Entering the lobby which is very big with a coffee shop one could think of a big hotel.After an efficient, friendly check-in the elevator reveals that the hotel is limited to 4 floors in the building (14 to 17 with a guest lounge and an outdoor smoking possibility on the 14th floor).The room even for Japanese conditions small. Around the bed there is not much space and the working table is rather small too. Otherwise room clean and equipped with what one needs. The carpet a little rugged and the bathroom small but very clean with the usual high tech toilet.Free WLAN working well in all parts if the hotel.Breakfast place overcrowded at times. Food selection ok even though after 2 days it gets very repetitive. Having dinner once is ok and the food quality is good but the selection of food is too limited. Around the hotel in walking distance there are various possibilities to have dinner.

Found the hotel on the internet, wrote to them and got a very kind answer. My room was on the top floor with a fantastic view over Tokyo, all the way to the Ferris wheel. The room had everything you need, including a great cotton pyjamas and was of quite a good size. Check in as well as check out was very quick and the staff most polite. It takes less than ten minutes to walk to tokyo Tower, beautiful parks nearby and the tube station is also very close. Taxi from the airport took app five minutes and cost less then Yen 2000. I can really recommend this hotel and will stay there again.

This nice hotel is also in a nice location, a short walk from the tokyo tower and also mita station, and about a 15 min walk to tamachi station. Rooms are clean and small (as are 90 percent of the rooms in tokyo), service is nice and friendly and the breakfast selection is amazing.All in all a good place to stay

The rooms were abit small but clean and well equipped. Nice handy location to local train stations and buses. Helpful tour desk and very friendly staff. The restaurant was a little expensive but very nice.

Rooms are very well equipped albeit a bit small but in Tokyo that's no wonder. Staff is very friendly and professional and the breakfast is ok. A bit more variety for breakfast would be good. I've now stayed there 5 times and the breakfast selection has always been the same. Very central location with just 30min by local train from Haneda airport (Asakusa line to Mita Station) it is a good place to stay. I can thoroughly recommend the hotel but would really wish for a bit more creativity in the breakfast menu.

It Was a Nice week, the room was clean, employees were very kind and were willing to satisfy customers. breakfast Was nice, Good quality for european standard. Pitty there is no gym. A bit expensive, on the other handicap Tokyo is expensive ...

Situated near the heart of Tokyo, Celestine Hotel targets mainly business travelers, but can also cater to vacation tourists. We had no problem with the advanced booking, paid cash (full payment, official receipt will be given at check-out).We stayed in a double room. What astounded me was their bathroom. It comes with a bathtub, advanced toilet and it was spacious. They were generous with the toiletries, they even refilled our shampoo and body wash. The view from the hotel was the city skyline. Not sure if they have rooms with the Tokyo tower view (walking distance from the hotel).The lobby had a cafe, which had desserts and pastries. It was elegant. You also have access to their garden and their "living room", where you can have free coffee and tea anytime of the day.They served American and Japanese breakfast, both were good, but during our 4-day stay, the buffet menu did not change. Not sure if they change it weekly. But the choices are many, from salmon sashimi to mini sausage franks, salads to cereals.There are many restaurants nearby, but not stores. Also, Tokyo tower is just walking distance, you can buy souvenirs below the tower.Though the hotel is a bit pricey, it is worth it.

A quiet and convenient hotel just a short walk from Tamachi station. Rooms are very clean, if a little tight. The free wi-fi is a great feature and made planning our days around Tokyo and Yokohama very easy.Tamachi station sits right on both the Yamanote line and the Keihin-Tohoku line, making it incredibly easy to get around. Mita station is also close and gives great access to the subway system, making places like Ginza and Asakusa simple to get to.Overall, this hotel is geared towards the business traveller but if you're a tourist, it's well worth considering.

This hotel is very fancy and well locagted close to train station by the end of the street. Staff is very polite and speak good English. The breakfast is basically japanese but is possible to find some ocidental food as well.At one of the floors you find a nice garden and a lounge with coffee and tea for free.

Last October I visited Tokyo for a conference, and I stayed at Celestine Hotel. It is located near a subway station, around 10 minutes walk from the hotel. Hotel staffs were very helpful and speak English fluently. Breakfast was superb. The room was very quiet that I can take a rest with a peaceful mind. There was also a vending machine and ice cube dispenser at each floor, it was very convenient.

I recently stayed one night at the Celestine Hotel. Locals colleagues in Japan recommended this hotel over others in Minato-ku because of the value and because our industry trade association had their meeting at this hotel in 2015. Indeed, The Celestine is an excellent value compared to other nearby international luxury chains, especially mid-week.The rooms are relatively big for Tokyo and my room on the 14th floor had an outstanding city view (sorry no photo). The bathroom is a little unusual in that there is a shower and tub which are separate but in a glass enclosed area within the bathroom. I have never seen such a design before.I did not have time for breakfast and my one complaint is that the breakfast voucher provided with the stay was good from 8 am. That is far too late for the business traveler.In general, I was pleased with The Celestine and would consider staying here again when in Tokyo. Note that my company's Japan head office is in Osaka and most of my business trips to Jepson are based in Osaka.

This hotel offers nice rooms which for Tokyo standard are fairly large. Small desk to work on, free internet of reasonable speed. Good quality bed. Humidifier in the room, which was nice in a period of dry winter weather. Bathroom a bit smaller, offering a bathtub, no separate shower.Friendly staff who speak good English. Good quality breakfast, with a buffet with a lot of Asian and European dishes. There is a lounge area with free coffe and tea, and a outside sitting area if the wheather is OK.Trainstation is very close.Would go back for a next trip.

Overall I really enjoyed my 2 night stay here and would stay here again if the price was right. Let's start with the pros, rooms are comfortable and mostly decent size for Tokyo standards. Staff is very helpful and friendly and most spoke English well. The overall location in Tokyo is fairly quiet for Tokyo and kind of centrally located but it's not exactly close to most places you want to go, except it's very close to Tokyo Tower and Shiba Park. Room was clean and bed was comfortable. On my last day I had a great view of Mt. Fuji from my room. On my floor there was a really nice lounge and courtyard area to relax in, but when your in Tokyo, it's unlikely you will spend too much time there.I didn't eat here, so I can't comment one way or another.This brings us to the cons, which really is location. Yes, it's very close to Toei Oedo and Mita Lines, but about 8 - 10 minute walk from Tamachi Station (JR) which is more convenient than the other Toei lines... If I could save a significant amount of money, I'd very happily stay here, but if I could find a hotel that was 8-10 minute walk (or less) from a more convenient station for close to the same price, it would be hard for me to return here as I value location more than most aspects of hotels while traveling in Tokyo.

We quite enjoyed our stay here, room had very nice view. There's also a small eat-street near-by where a lot of locals go after dark (some open till 2am), but you can also get breakfast here. Tamachi train station is about 7-10 min away, but from here you can get anywhere.

We stayed here for 2.5 weeks, the room had a great view and was a good size for Tokyo. The hotel is in a great location close to transport.The location was lovely and quiet, but had plenty of places to eat within easy walking distance. The concierge staff were incredibly helpful, they help us out with making calls, getting us information, booking different things.We would recommend this hotel to family and friends and would stay there again.Thank you for an excellent stay

Rooms are relatively small (expect that in Tokyo) but comfortable. Two adults w/ luggage should be fine. Rooms and baths were clean. Housekeeping staff was on top of everything. Front desk staff was very good at what they did.Breakfast was good, but needs more variety (90% of it was the same every day). Vegetarian options are limited, but carnivores will be fine. Wait staff was very good. Cafe had limited choices but is good. If you really want to try local cuisine, walk across the street (take the pedestrian bridge actually), and walk down a narrow lane. You will find plenty of small restaurants catering to local tastes. For the Yanks, there is a Domino's nearby that delivers but order from them online (deals are better).The hotel is in a business district, so finding places to eat within walking distance on weekends is a challenge. Almost all small restaurants are closed on weekends and things can look deserted.There is a shrine within walking distance. Tokyo tower is a 15 min walk and Hibiya park about 30 min. Taxis are always plentiful in Tokyo and there is a subway station entrance a stone's throw from the hotel. If you want to catch the JR line to take you to Ueno park, the JR station is about a 10 min walk.

Amazing.... and relaxed stay. My family of 4 stayed in this amazing hotel for 4 nights and I must say we thoroughly enjoyed the stay. Room Service and food quality was really good. Staff is very prompt. Thank youHighly recommended

Before entering the hotel, I admired the hotel from the outside first and when I entered the place, it's much more. The staffs were very helpful and spoke in English very well.Our room was not too big but had a great view from the window. We even turned off the light and our lights were coming from the outside. Yes, we so liked our room at the 14th floor. Then we enjoyed the free drinks all night long. The breakfast we had was superb. I do highly recommend this hotel as it's a great hotel to be at. And lastly, this is very near to Tokyo Tower. Enjoyed the stay to this great hotel!!!

A hotel that can be easily located in the area of Minato-ku. A few minutes walk from the Mita subway station (exit A10 and 8 are the closest). It takes about 35 minutes to the station from Haenda airport. Purchase a pasmo card from the ticket machines to make travelling convenient. This hotel offers a peaceful location with a convenience store a few minutes walk down the road. Don't expect modern decor, the hotel is a bit dated.The hotel is clean, and adequate. For hotels the rooms are a decent size with space to place luggage. The plus side for the rooms is that they are non smoking rooms. Toiletries are supplied and replaced on a daily basis. Breakfast is adequate, serving a small range of English and Asian cuisine. Expect the same thing every day. The staff are polite and helpful. You can leave your bags for safe keeping if you arrive early and after check out. A taxi to the airport costs approximately 5000-6000 yen. You can ask the hotel to arrange for you on departure. There is also the option of the shuttle bus which I recommend you book early at the reception. Most of the major tourist sights can be reached by subway travel under 30 minutes. This is my second visit to Tokyo, in addition to previous recommendations, I would recommend Odeo-Onsen Monogatari (they have a website check it out) and the Shiro-hige cafe for Totoro puffs (although you will need to book this). Oh don't forget good walking shoes, you will find you will be going up and down a lot of stairs and walking long passages :)Have a wonderful trip!

The Celestine Hotel is located centrally in Minato, yet in a peaceful location in the heart of the city. One of the my favorite things about the hotel was the location. The walk is about 6-7 blocks to the nearest Subway or JR station keeping you reasonably close but in a quieter setting. The hotel actual occupies the upper floors of a primarily office complex with a lobby on the ground floor and rooms on levels 14-17. There's a couple of restaurants within the building plus a hotel lounge on level 14. Our room was on the 17th level and we had requested a nice view which we received. We had a cozy double room facing the city skyline.Service is polite but reserved at this hotel. I have no complaints but don't expect proactive or extra-attentive staff. If you want a quiet stay with service only when needed, the Celestine is a good option. The rooms are small, but that's expected for a city like Tokyo. The bathroom has a good shower stocked with quality, full-size toiletries which I appreciate. I kind of feel that travel size toiletries can be wasteful. Linens are comfy and they even provide pajamas, even if they were a bit roomy on me. The room didn't have an iron but I believe they provided one on request. Wi-Fi was exceptional without any problems.Overall, our stay at the Celestine Hotel was pleasant and easy. The location worked well and the room provided a good place to good some good sleep during our trip.

Comfortable room, friendly staff, and wonderful hot breakfast banquet including both western and traditional Japanese food. The guest lounge is great, with free coffee, nice ginger snap biscuits, and access to more seating outside. Free wi-fi throughout the entire premises. Shibakoen station is next door. Ten minute walk to Tamachi station and small lively street bars and cafes, where we drank sake and had fun eating traditional foods with the locals!

Melbourne, Australia

review_body: The hotel is located in Minato-ku, Tokyo city center, neat to the Tokyo seaport and Tokyo tower, in10 minues walking distance from Mita station, what makes transportation to / from the hotel nice & easy. Such a location is similarly good for both - business and sightseeing visitors. A room was slightly bigger than average "business hotels" in Japan and fully equipped with everything you may need while travelling - TV, refrigerator, electric tea pot, slippers, piоamas, etc. Bath room is equipped with a washlet (warm seat, bidet...), fan, full set of cosmetic stuffs like separate body, hand and face soaps, shampoo, hair conditioner - whatever you may need. Soft enough bed and perfect bedding helps you to feel really relaxed in the morning. Central air conditioner works perfect and very silently, keeping room temperature / humidity in very comfort conditions. Receptionists are quite fast, friendly, speak English good, and ready to help you whenever you need. Hotel lobby is great and gorgeous, suitable for quick meeting with the cup of coffee. The only thing that I can call disadvantage is very short time for breakfast, that finishes at 9:30, so you must wake up early enough to be in time - this is not a problem for business people, but definitely puts tourist customers in tough timeframes. Overall, Celestine Hotel made very nice impression and encouraging to select it again for next stay in Tokyo.

Moscow, Moscow City, Russia

review_body: The house keeping was very good. Everything essential is provided with good quality. The breakfast however is boring. Everyday menu is the same. Not very tasty but still edible.Customer service is good. Location is good with many fantastic resturant down the street. Walking distance to subway & metro.

On special around $250 Australian for a night. Foyer on ground floor, hotel is based around 3 floors 15-17 ? .Good sized rooms for Japan. Clean . A few Western TV channels. Clean , tidy , no smoke smell . Complementary coffee and cheap biscuits in guest lounge. Quick lifts Free morning paper. Very friendly , efficient andhelpful reception staff. 500 meter walk to subway. Quiet area but there are some bars and restaurants scattered around.Great view over Tokyo harbour. Breakfast was good - around 2200 Yen.Didn't have the pancakes others have raved about. Would stay here again

Amenities were great. Not needed to buy additional. Room was quiet. The location is quiet at night but safe. Nearby supermarkets available.Overall, I will summarize by saying you get more than your buck.

There is honestly nothing negative I can say about our stay here. It's in a very quiet part of Tokyo (mostly office buildings), the service was great and the view from our room was amazing. It's a bit of a walk to get to the train station (about 10 minutes) but we knew about this based on the map location so this is not a negative, I'm just mentioning it for those travelers who want to be close to the public transport.

The hotel is ideally located close to the business districts of Tokyo. The staff is very helpful and ensured smooth check-in / check-out. In terms of sight seeing Celestine is a short walk away from Tokyo Tower and not that far from Odaiba as well. Breakfast menu was good (western) and if you want to sample Japanese style breakfast that too is available. The views from the room are nice with the skyline of Tokyo visible. Would recommend Celeste for people looking for a convenient location in a peaceful hotel environment.

Check-in and Check-out was very smooth with English speaking staff at the front desk. The breakfast menu was very good with a fully Western menu. Although the rooms were a bit small, it was expected in this part of the world so one cannot complain. The rooms were quite sound-proof and got a good night's sleep.

Comfortable quiet hotel . Good English speaking staff and excellent location. Excellnet service level.You can also take a walk to Tokyo Tower from the hotel. The staff were very helpful and efficient arranging Airport transfers.

Relatively inexpensive: approx. 100€/night. Very good service. Rooms are small but not too much for Tokyo. Lounge on 14th floor and external patio (only place for smokers) are very pleasant. Wifi is relatively speedy. I will come back and I recommend.

Our second stay at the Celestine Hotel and we really enjoyed it once again. Check in is 2.00, handy if you've arrived into the country that morning. Very helpful staff, lovely marble foyer, excellent Rayon Vert Cafe for cakes, breakfast and other light meals. The coffee lounge on the fourteenth floor is great! With complimentary tea, coffee and biscuits all day, it's somewhere different to relax. And there are French doors opening onto a pretty outdoor space if you want to get some fresh air. (There's one area at each side- smoking and no smoking). The Superior rooms were just large enough; there seems to be a variety of larger/smaller rooms to choose from.It's a short walk to JR Tamachi Station on the Yamanote Line and the subway. You can also take a walk to Tokyo Tower from the hotel. There are several Convenience Stores around, the nearest is 2 minutes away around the back, past Tulleys Coffee shop then left. The staff were very helpful and efficient arranging the forwarding of our luggage when we left.

Comfortable quiet hotel . Good English speaking staff and excellent location . We paid more for a bigger room after the first night , worth it to enhance our holiday . Nice interior courtyard garden serving free coffee / tea , newspapers etc . Breakfast Buffett good but very busy . Cafe in foyer does a lovely breakfast as well , half the price of buffet .

This hotel is conveniently located near 3 metro stations. Staff is friendly, rooms are very clean. They have an special shared room with complimentary coffee, tea and cookies all they long. Room is a bit small, as most of the hotels in Tokyo. Would stay there again. Nothing to complain

Rooms a good size for JAPAN. Pancakes for breakfast just Devine. Location was close to rail station. Would definitely recommend and stay again. Discovered a great Italian restaurant behind hotel. I suggest a trip up Tokyo tower walking distance from Celestine.

Great hotel, staff were lovely and helpful. Room was excellent (small, but to be expected in this city!) with fantastic city view. Quite reasonably priced, not tooooo far to walk to nearest train station. Free wifi included

This is a 4* hotel. Lobby is beautiful. Rooms tiny. Breakfast was poor.Room was really small but clean and quiet with a good wi-fi. I can recommend for business trips. Good location. Frankly speaking a little bit to pricy.

Celestine hotel is a good choice for people travelling to Tokyo. The rooms are not very large (but it's normal from Japan) but nice. Also good price/quality ratio. Also close to the subway so you can move around town pretty easily.

The hotel was comfortable, clean and provided all our needs. Staff were able to communicate well in English, were charming and helpful. Rooms were clean, beds comfortable and had good facilities. Close to public transport/trains and near to places of interest. Hotel pick ups for tours. Nice restaurants at Hotel and close by. Really enjoyed out stay. Had a great lounge where you could help yourself to tea or coffee anytime, sit in the open garden, read a book etc.

Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: My sister and I spent 3 days in Tokyo and really loved this hotel. The rooms are on the smaller side but most in Japan are pretty small. The bathroom had plenty of room for 2 people to be using it at once and there was plenty of closet space. On the 14th floor they have a lounge with free coffee, tea and water. This was a great place to relax on the couches after a long day walking around. Wifi is available and the lounge has an actual PC you can use for 100 yen for 10 mins. Great if you have a couple emails you need to check fast or look something up. The hotel is a 5-10 min walk from the Mita Subway station and Tamachi JR railway station. This was suuuuper convenient. We were able to use the Tamachi station multiple times to get everywhere we needed in Tokyo. The station is off one of the main lines that connects to Shibuya, Tokyo and Ueno station. The lobby is very spacious with a nice Cafe on the first floor. We opted out of the breakfast run by the hotel and just bought breakfast at the Cafe. It was a little cheaper but very good. They had a couple options and plenty of coffee and cakes to choose from. The coffee here was really quite good. If that's not your cup of tea then there is a Tully's coffee shop around the corner in the same building. Also very convenient. If you fly in or out of Haneda airport the hotel is a 7 min cab ride from the Hamamatsucho station which has a direct line to the Airport. This doesn't cost anything if you have a JR pass which we did. Overall I really really liked this hotel. It was perfect for our needs and I would definitely stay here again.

I can't say enough about the service and quality of the Celestine Hotel. This was the last hotel that I stayed in in March/ April 2008 Tokyo trip for work. The view that I had of Mt Fuji was beautiful. Service at the Celestine was awesome. Staff was very attentive. The room was spotless and had many amenities. I would definitely stay again.

I stayed here for 7 nights in August of 2015. This hotel is IDEAL for visitors. It's within walking distance to Mita subway station and the Tamachi JR station (which is on the green Yamanote line that encircles Tokyo--SUPER convenient). The hotel staff is very nice and hospitable, and the concierge is available 24 hours (during the day, there are English speakers). The 14th floor is a beautiful floor all guests have access to that is stocked with coffee, tea, books, lounges, and water. The daily breakfast in the lobby runs about $20 and offers delicious western and Japanese-style food. The rooms are pretty spacious compared to other Japanese hotels. The hotel is well-maintained and aesthetically pleasing. The wifi is great both in the room and in the lobby. There are grocery stores nearby as well as Japanese, Italian, and American (McDonalds) restaurants within walking distance. I highly recommend this hotel.

Visited Tokyo for business purposes. Stayed at the Celestine for 4 nights. The room was small but cosy, very functional and extremely clean. The hotel is not located at a central area however it is comfortably located between two very well connected subway stations. The food at the breakfast buffet was very good though limited in variety.All in all, given the price per night, I highly recommend the Celestine.

The hotel is modern and very clean, with a bit of a Western touch. The staff is exceptionally polite and friendly, as you expect in Japan. Our room is not large by US standards, but it is perfectly suitable for two people to stay comfortably. The bed is soft. Free Wi-Fi. Bathroom is clean and modern. Heated toilet seats! Central A/C. We have a garden view room and it is beautiful. The hotel is quiet. Very short walk to metro station. Overall, we are very happy with our choice to stay here.

we stayed here for 5 nights when arrived to Tokyo. Although it is a bit far from the center, it is quite well located by train (7 minutes walking from the hotel) and it si a very quite/business like area. Everybody was very professional and kind to us and we were enough lucky to be located at the same floor as the library, where one can have some free good coffee and relax in the terrace and on the couches, while reading some beautiful books! I will go back for sure!

New York City, New York

review_body: We chose this hotel for our first four days in Tokyo and I think we got really lucky. After spending two more nights near by Shibuya Crossing I can compare at least two different districts to be in. Celestine hotel is perfect for the tourists. Located near by Tokyo tower, at first the hotel may seem a little bit isolated from the city action. In reality it is close to a lot of restaurants, some of which turned to be pretty amazing, just walk few blocks away or follow the recommendations of the little map of the area you can find in the lobby. The hotel is near by three metro lines, Shibakoen station of Mita line is just a block away from it and also it is relatively close to Tsukiji market (you still need to use a taxi to get there early in the morning). The rooms are comfortable and very clean. The personnel in the hotel is amazing, extremely helpful and of course over polite. The hotel has nice coffee shop at the lobby where you can grab a beer and a very decent bite if the jet lag doesn't allow you to explore the area.

Room was spacious by Tokyo standard. Daily breakfast was nice but more variety should be added.Within walking distance to the metro station.Quite a number of nice eateries within 10 minutes stroll.Hotel staff are very polite and helpful.Internet wifi was strong throughout.There is a lounge on 14th floor where guests can mingle with free coffee/tea and biscuits all day.

This is our first time in Japan and decided to spend our first 3 nights at Celestine Hotel.We were surprised and did not expect a spacious corner room (we heard Japan has small hotel rooms), remote controlled drapes, and complete set of toiletries with extra items like branded facial cleansing cream, facial lotion, moisturizer, bath salts and disposable wash cloth. We love the city view, (including the Tokyo tower) from our room. The hotel staff are polite and can understand and speak english. Train stations are just walking distance and there are restaurants near the hotel which offer good quality food at an affordable price.

We stayed here for six nights this summer and had a chance to enjoy the Celestine's consistently professional service and impeccable clean rooms. Yes, the rooms are Tokyo-small, but the price is reasonable. Breakfast is notably good, with Japanese and western menus to mix and match. Staff are superb and endlessly helpful in English as needed. Location is a easy walk to subway and Keio University. Numerous restaurants in the neighborhood, so we did not try the Celestine restaurant for dinner. Highly recommended.

Stayed at the Celestine hotel during my stay in Tokyo. Hotel is very modern, with a large lobby, and decent size rooms. Location is very good and within 10 minutes walk from a restaurant packed quarter of Tokyo that should not be missed. Breakfast at the hotel offers a mix of Asian or western style food, and has great choices.

Stayed 6 nights with husband. Arrived early, reception were friendly and happy to hold our bags until we returned. Room was clean and there was enough room for bags etc. Great views and quiet at night. Location was also handy to a number of train/subway lines, though those using the JR line will still need to walk a few blocks. We didn't spend much time in the communal area but it looked like a nice place to hang out and had sufficient tea and coffee facilities. We enjoyed our stay here with the only down side being the pillows, which flattened significantly when slept on. Would certainly stay again.

This hotel seemed to cater more to business travellers but it was still a great hotel with some fantastic views over Tokyo. It is very close to the monorail which is why we stayed here for our last night in Japan - for ease of travel to the airport. The hotel bar was great and the barman made some excellent cocktails! Not great for transport if you have the JR pass as there is about 15 minutes walk from the Yamanote Line. It is very close to Tokyo Tower though.

This hotel had large, beautiful, well appointed rooms, and the staff are consistently very gracious and service oriented. Just after arrival, we walked outside to get dinner, and a receptionist ran after us with 2 umbrellas for our use. There is a lovely rooftop garden with a hotel guest lounge adjacent. There was a 3 prong western type socket in our room. The location was excellent - easy 3 block walk to the Tamachi JR station and even easier access to the subway so you can access transportation to any location. The staff speak English well enough to address any issue. There are a number of small restaurants and convenience stores (Lawson snd Family Mart) within 2 blocks. I highly recommend this hotel.

It's hard to know where to stay if you're a first-time visitor faced with the pros and cons of different neighborhoods as well as wanting to be sure that you'll be comfortable, get good value for money, and have a great Tokyo experience. The Celestine Hotel fit the bill splendidly. Access from the airport is easy: take the Skytrain to Nipporo, quick change to the Yamanote line, and off at Tamachi Station in less than an hour. The neighborhood, near Keio Univeristy, the NEC building, and rolls royce dealerships is smart and quiet, but there are four blocks of restaurants in a warren of little streets across from Tamachi station. Access to all sights and shopping destinations is very easy as you have several different subway lines within easy walking distance. The hotel itself occupies three floors high up in an office building. Rooms are bigger than you might expect for this city, and one morning, mine, looking West from the 15th floor, showed a view of Mt Fuji!

The Celestine Hotel was the first hotel I stayed in on my first trip to Japan. In Europe this would easily be a 4-star hotel, so this was a fantastic deal at $125 a night (including breakfast--which had dozens of offerings including Japanese and American/European food, all of which were fantastic). My room was on the 16th floor, which had a good view of the city. The room was small, but extremely clean, and it included a refrigerator, mini-bar, and snacks. The queen bed was excellent, and it included feather pillows, which added to the comfort. The room included a private shower with completely modern fixtures as well as a fancy Japanese toilet with all the cleaning options you could desire. The room also had highly effective room darkening curtains, which helped because the sun rises in this land of the rising sun around 4:15 am this time of year (late June on my visit). The climate control in the room worked perfectly.On the 14th floor there is a spacious lounge with a browsing library, comfortable chairs, sofas, an espresso/coffee machine that grinds its own beans, and a mineral water dispenser. There is a nice courtyard outside should you like to take your coffee in the open air. The machine produced decent coffee, though not great, but I was overjoyed to have this option because with my jet lag I was up about 4:00 am each morning and needed a cup before breakfast, which starts at 7:00 am. The staff who work for the hotel are exceedingly polite and attentive. The lobby is elegant and spacious, and the hotel is just a block away from the Mita metro station, which I found convenient. The hotel is also close to areas with a multitude of restaurants. The only reason I gave this a "very good" rather than an excellent is because there is no exercise facility. After all my walking and sightseeing, I suppose there was not really a need, but I did miss lifting weights and stretching during my week stay at this otherwise wonderful hotel. I also wish the hotel dinner dining and bar were a bit more reasonably priced. If they were, I might have tried them. With prices quadruple what I could find a block away, there wasn't a chance I was staying in, even on one of the rainy nights during my stay. I highly recommend coming to Tokyo and staying at the Celestine Hotel. It is more than worth the price. The Japanese people and culture are truly impressive.

Lovely hotel in nice quiet neighbourhood. The staff were all delightful and extremely friendly. The hotel is within easy walking distance of the trainmen and metro and a perfect location for getting around the city.

I spent a total of 7 nights at this hotel in two stays. It is conveniently located close to the underground and is a short walk from Tamachi station where the JR Yamanote line runs from giving access to stations for the bullet train. I had a twin room with my sister. The room we had was not overly spacious but contained everything we needed including a safe. All rooms are on floors 14 - 16 so most will have great city views. It has a couple of bars - one that doesn't open at weekends as the hotel is situated in the business district. The breakfast is buffet style and caters for Westerners along with traditional Japanese and there is free sparkling wine at the weekends! Word of caution we checked in early morning after a long flight as the room was ready. We got charged for an additional night. Overall I would recommend this hotel.

My girlfriend and i spent a week at the Celestine in June 2015 -- there on work. The room was not huge -- but no surprises there. It was comfortable and kept clean. The hotel staff is extremely friendly and helpful -- they make you feel as if they actually wanted to make you feel welcome and were prepared to do whatever they could to make your stay a success. The breakfast is fine -- reasonably priced. The hotel is close to the subway if u choose to navigate around the city via this means. I strongly recommend the Celestine.

We got a great early bird deal on our room at the Celestine and we were extremely happy with the value! The Celestine Hotel is similar or better than a high end Hilton or Marriott in the USA. The room and service were excellent. Staff spoke good English. It is a convenient walk to the Mita and Tamachi stations and there is a Starbucks and Family Market nearby. We took the Narita Express from the airport (4,000 yen round-trip per person), got off at Shinagawa station and then took a taxi to the hotel (less than 2,000 yen total).

We booked this hotel 5 months in advance and therefore were entitled to a 36% early booking bonus. We stayed in a superior double room which was 21 sq-meter in size. The room felt quite big. The room was extremely clean and the beds were very comfortable. There was a small sofa and coffee table, as well as a desk and chair.The bathroom was a good size with a nice bathtub and shower. The water pressure and temperature were great.I have to say that when we first entered the hotel lobby, our first reaction was "wow!". The lobby is gorgeous and you really feel like you are staying in a high end hotel. The front desk staff are extremely helpful and very pleasant. We were waiting outside one day for a friend to pick us up. The front desk staff noticed us standing there and quickly came outside to ask if we were in need of a taxi.We usually used the Tamachi Station (which is on the Yamamote line), and is approximately a 10 minute walk away.I would highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again. The normal room cost can be quite expensive, however if you book far enough in advance, you can get a fantastic deal.

Have regularly stayed at the Celestine Hotel the last 3 years on my business trips to Tokyo. It is a comfortable, friendly Hotel in a quiet business area of the Shibakoen area. Rooms are very clean and small as per Tokyo standards and are on levels 14 - 17 and are all non-smoking rooms.Laundry service is reasonably priced and service is also available on the weekend. As it is a business area there are no restaurants and bars close by but only a few at the back of the Hotel. Recommend heading up to Tamachi for the Izakayas with plenty of different cooking styles to choose from that is about a 5 min walk. Travel Tip : Take the Narita Sky Access Limited Express from Narita Airport and get off at Mita Station that is only a couple of minutes walk to the Celestine. (Cost 1380 yen)

Trained travelled all around south Japan. On a direct subway line(blue) from Tokoyo rail station an 100 metres from exit its perfect. Well placed in up market area , I booked a couple of months early an received a good rate (for Japan) great staff with good English an beyond helpful, can't praise enough. Pub was hugely comfortable. Understand, rooms in Japan are small all of them(unless ya pay a fortune) and even some of them, but this was lovely. (ya could, swing a cat) We didn't eat their , too pricey, but why would ya with all the choices everywhere. This place I would send my friends.

Our first 4 nights in Tokyo were spent at the Celestine and we thought it was a great choice. We were surprised at the size of our corner twin room, as when researching different hotels to book, a recurring theme was that a lot of Japanese hotel rooms are small. We did not find this to be so here.The beds were very comfy, the bathroom was super clean and loaded with first class toiletries. Capsule coffee machine,electric curtains, movies on demand and fast free wi-fi too.Our room was on the 14th floor which also had a good lounge area with a free coffee and tea facility. Nice touch.The neighbourhood was quiet at night which suited us, and a lovely park containing Zojoji Temple was an easy stroll. Subway to everywhere less than a block away. We rode to Roppongi in 6 stops.If you walk through to the back of the hotel there are several nice restaurants grouped together.We ate at all of them and they were all good. Can't remember their names but they're easy to find.Breakfast was included in our rate and had plenty of choices. We never waited and it was never crowded.If you're after raging nightlife this may not be the hotel for you but we really enjoyed our stay here and recommend it for comfort, value and really nice staff.

We stayed in the Celestine Hotel for 7 nights during our recent visit to Tokyo. The only downside to the hotel was that it was located in a business district and was a 5-10 minute taxi ride from most of the main centres of Tokyo.Nevertheless, it was a nice comfortable hotel at a reasonable price with rooms bigger than most Tokyo hotels.With stations for both rail and underground close by, it was a good centre for trips around Tokyo.

I read Trip Advisor's review before and they were right. It was a very nice clean hotel near a train station and a subway station. It was in the middle of office buildings so weekend was quiet but we found good resaurants to eat around the hotel. Very convenient too.

Tokyo is huge and a nicely located hotel is vital to make the most of your time in this beautiful city Celestine is fitting the bill 5 tube stops from the airport, 3 tube stops in a 10 minutes walk radius, close to rappongi .. What can you ask for more The hotel itself is clean, nice, with a little of personal touch and a great lounge with a huge balcony to relax during the day Overall I would recommend this hotel

As per other reviews, the rooms are indeed a little small (for 2 people) but the staff are excellent. The hotel is 1 minute walk from Mita tube station allowing quick and easy access to all areas. Dint really eat much here but the meals we had were good. The free coffee facilities in the library were excellent and very rare. Didn't notice any extra charges for two which is more than can be said for the American chains who seem to want to charge additional for wifi even at their extortionate room rates.

Upon researching for awhile for a suitable hotel my gf found this little gem! Situated in a nice location away from the main busy night life, with subway entrees close by this was ideal! To top it off it's an easy 15 minutes walk to the amazing tokyo tower! There are also many restaurants within 10 minutes walk and a very handy lawsons convenience store close by.The hotel itself is very clean and well kept. The staff service is superb! They are also very happy to help you book tours if your japanese is limited. In the main lobby there are plenty of flyers for tours and good locations for tourists. To top that off the flyers come in many languages, japanese, English, Korean, even French!We went for the room that is next one up on the cheapest and it was nicely sized for a Tokyo hotel. Includes pretty much any amenity you will need in a hotel, from cleaning lotions, to shavers, fresh daily towels, hair dryer, wardrobe with hangers and a safe, even a plug adapter so you can use the European 3 pins! The only draw back was that the fridge was not cool at all it was barely chilling our cold drinks. But this was not a big deal to us.All in all this is perhaps one of the best hotels I have stayed in. With fantastic service and the location of it, this is an ideal place for any visitors to tokyo!

In business area of Minato in Tokyo ...this hotel is well simply decorated worthing a 5 star rating even for the Asian hotels rating...Maybe is a 4 star because of non spa amenities...The rooms viewing from 14 floor the city... having also access to an old style inner pavilion offering coffees and teas...24h that you can use plus for relaxing too and reading....in a such a nice ambiance...

Everything about this hotel was fine. The rooms are small but comfortable and clean. It is a fairly average sort of place, and there is nothing to get excited about. The one downside is that it is a little out of the way but there is a street very near by full over restaurants and bars.

Brilliant hotel and only a short walk to the metro or railway. Rooms were spacious and clean. Breakfast was disappointing at least for the western menu, lack of choice and poor quality for a top hotel. Bar does not open for long and when we were there it closed on Saturdays and sundays. In addition it closed for a private party so for a 5 night stay it opened 2 nights for 4 hours. Overall a great hotel badly let down by its services.

The good:-- Hotel staff is extremely nice and friendly-- Very clean-- Easy to findThe bad:-- Hidden fees. We were charged an extra 2000 yen/night to have two people in the room, even though it is already a room for two people. -- Very small rooms. Very. You think you're prepared for 200 square feet, but it feels even smaller.--Not really near anything. I wasn't familiar with Tokyo before booking... I wouldn't choose this area again. It's very safe, but it's about a 10 min walk from the JR/main train, and isn't really central to any of the main tourist attractions.I would have rated this higher but for the price we paid after the extra fees, the hotel just was not worth it.

We enjoyed a couple of nights at the Celestine in Feb 2015. Unfortunately for us, it was Chinese new year and we had to pay top rates due to all of the hotels in Tokyo being booked out. Aside from that, the Celestine is a quality property, in a great location. The breakfast restaurant is first class. The hotel is a only a few minutes cab ride from major Tokyo stations. I do not speak Japanese, however most of the staff had a reasonable understanding of English and some staff spoke excellent English.

I have stayed there for the past 13 years and is a hidden gem in Tokyo, perfect for vacation or business small clean and very friendly staff. Private place. Close to Tokyo tower. Perfect location if you want to stay in an area that is the upscale in Tokyo.

After an extensive and exhausting search for a good, quality place to stay in Tokyo over the Lunar New Year holiday (when Tokyo seems to get a lot of tourists!), we settled on Celestine Hotel. The price, and quality of a large hotel room in Tokyo is something of a precious commodity it seems and Celestine nicely fills the gap with large, clean rooms at reasonable prices by Tokyo standards. Part of this has to do with the location of the hotel: it's not in a "stylish" tourist area as you're basically in-between a bunch of office buildings in a business district that is extremely QUIET on weekends. However, that should by no means deter you from staying here as it is perhaps one of the more accessible hotels in Tokyo: 1) The hotel is a stop on one of the Narita Airport Limo bus lines, and it's basically 30 minutes by train to Haneda airport or a quick car ride. 2) You're a short walk and one subway stop from Shinagawa Station which is great if you are taking the Shinkansen to southern prefectures like Osaka and Kyoto3) You're wedged in-between two subway stations on one of the main subway lines in Tokyo4) There's a bus stop not too far away that can get you to Roppongi Hills in under 20 minutes5) Walking distance to Tokyo Tower, a main tourist attraction. Quick 10 minute taxi ride to Tsukiji fish market if you choose to rise early for the breakfast sushi or the tuna auction. Upon arrival to the hotel, check-in was quick and efficient. The whole hotel is non-smoking which is AWESOME. Our room was on the side that faced Tokyo harbor and we had a semi-obstructed view of the bridge which was nice. The room was clean and SPACIOUS and nicely appointed. In fact, it was quite large for Tokyo standards. The lobby of the hotel gives off the impression the hotel is a bit dated but the rooms and corridors are anything but that. Service here is good but can be a bit robotic at times. We didn't try the food here and were hardly in the room but we were all around happy with this property and would easily stay here again.The only thing that could be improved upon was the bathrooms: the water pressure in the shower was a bit low. Other than that, this place is great to stay in!

Me and Mrs stayed in the hotel for 6 nights and had no issues. Very close to Mita Subway Station and Tamachi JR station. I recommend book room with breakfast if you like having heavy breakfast. Walking distance from a very good Indian Restaurant (Holi Restaurant).JR will take approx 15 to Shibuya and 25 mins to Shinjuku.

Generally all hotels I have stayed in Tokyo have been good..... this hotel is better than good... The rooms are slightly larger than others I have stayed at in a relative way because people who travel to Tokyo know how small the rooms can be and those additional few additional inches do make a difference.. :) rooms well appointed, brilliant house keeping, well laid out breakfast...... close to Shinagawa station etc etc overall brilliant experience..... the best part of the hotel is the common library and meeting area on the 14th floor which is ver very nice.. thank you

I've stayed at the Celestine Hotel for the first time. Reception staff was very efficient and friendly, yet a bit less than in other top hotels I've stayed in Tokyo before. The room has everything you need, minibar is a bit sparsely stocked, pillows are not very good but overall everything ok. Internet works really well and bathroom has everything you need. The restaurant is very expensive for the small menu and the small dishes and I would not recommend to eat there for dinner. I had twice curry at the cafe in the lobby which was ok but definitely no top range dinner, however price was more reasonable. The breakfast in the hotel is acceptable and has a reasonable buffet but I would expect a little more variety. Overall I would say it is a good hotel for the price and definitely ok to stay.

We booked this hotel mainly because of its proximity to Haneda airport. We caught the Keikyu-Kuko Line airport rapid directly with no train changes, a few minutes walk using the directions on the hotel website and we were at the hotel. We noticed that there is also a limousine bus service to Haneda and, to and from Narita airport, which is convenient. The room was very comfortable with fast, free wifi. Our only disappointment was to find the attached hotel restaurant, Grand Cross was not non- smoking at dinner. With many other restaurant options a short walk away, we opted to eat elsewhere.

We took the Celestine Hotel due to its price for the days we stayed there compared to other hotels in Tokyo. However we did not take its location into consideration. Directly next to the NEC Corporation supertower it maybe is perfect for business travelera, and also its proximity to the Tokyo Tower and the Imperial Palace (sort of) is good for tourists, however we already had checked out theae places beforehand. As such location was not attractive for us and we had to take the JR line to get anywhere.Room itself was very standard and similar to Dawa Royalnet hotels or Richmond hotels. Hot water somehow was not sooo stable but didnt disturb our bathing. Would we come again? No mostly because lf location? Would we recommend for NEC travelers? Most likely yes.

I found the hotel to be up to the international standard - you get everything you normally expect in a "standard" quality hotel around the world. Nice Japanese hint comes with with thoughtful choice and presentation of the skin/hair care products in the bathroom, nice choice of Japanese/Asian choices completing "European" choice for the breakfast, superb level of customer-oriententation of the staff. I also appreciated a cosy lounge (in- and outside space) open for the customers 24/7 with tea/coffee, library, etc.
user_name:
LiuLiok
New York City, New York

review_body: I first stayed at the "Celestine Hotel" the first week in October 2014 and then again most recently for 4 nights 3rd to 7th February 2015. This hotel is more of a business hotel, (probably used a great deal by people involved with NEC whose HQ is next door), than a tourist hotel but that said it is close (walking distance) to some good tourist sights like the Tokyo Tower and the Zojo-ji Temple. It also is nicely located easy use of the Tokyo Subway as there are a couple of Stations in easy walking distance, (Mita Station being the closest with Exit A8 or A10 just a couple of minutes walk from the hotel). This makes exploring the rest of Tokyo very easy and I visited the Imperial Palace, Tokyo Station, Sensoji-Temple (Asakusa) and the Tokyo SkyTree all very easily from here using the fast and efficient Tokyo Subway System.The hotel is efficient, modern and clean and the rooms were comfortable and well equipped. Both times I stayed on the 15th Floor in Superior Double Rooms, (Room 1564 first time and Room 1520 the second time), and the rooms were both much the same. I used the Café in the lobby a few times and it was very good, and I ate breakfast at the hotel restaurant on one occasion (cost JPY2,200) and that was also okay. I found all the staff, as you'd expect in Tokyo, to be efficient, polite and courteous at all times. The room rates are not cheap at circa JPY17,000 per night (about GB£100) but it is a high quality hotel with a top level of service.You can get to the hotel from Haneda Airport either using the train/subway for a few hundred Yen or if you want to take a cab it will cost about JPY6,000 and takes about 30 minutes. I would certainly stay here again and expect to in the coming months.

For a last minute find this hotel was great! We stayed here for 4 nights and it suited us fine for heading out on days trips. The price was average and the location was pretty useful if you're wanting to explore Tokyo whilst being a bit further away from the rough and tumble of the crowds. The room was a decent size and we had a good view of the city with views of Mt. Fuji in the distance. The service was brilliant and all the staff seemed to be friendly and helpful. We only had the breakfast from the hotel once and it was adequate however maybe a bit cold for my liking but it did the job. We would recommend this place for exploring as it is a good base and easy to find/ get to.

We stayed for 2 nights as a family of 4 and had 2 rooms. The rooms were the standard ones, so were fairly small. Its a large hotel, clean and friendly. We had no issues and I would recommend it. The hotel bar was a bit strange, its just about 10 seats up against the bar, in the restaurant. The location is a bit quiet, not much around. However it;s not far to the walk to the Tokyo Tower, and then to get a bus or taxi to the imperial palace or Tokyo station. Also not to far from the fish market. We did find a small back alley about 10 mins walk, away, full of local restaurants. We had an amazing sushi in one of them. I preferred our stays in Shinjuku and Shibuya areas as there is more to see and do there. This was a good option, if you want to be a bit closer to Tokyo centre.

We stayed in the hotel for 5 nights. Location of the hotel is within 10 mins walk to Mita station and 15 mins walk to Yamanote JR line. The room is very spacious with in room wifi and king size bed. There were also eateries within 5 mins walk around the hotel. Tokyo tower is about 30 mins walk and you will pass by Shiba park which is beautiful. Overall the hotel is worth staying if you are looking for a quite side of tokyo that's not crowded with people.

We stayed here for 5 nights over New Years Eve. The hotel,was well located near train and subway lines and easy to get to by train and subway from Narita airport. The room was compact but very comfortable, and really quiet with no street noise or noise from other rooms or corridors. The were lots of small eating places and bars very close by, unfortunately many were closed over New Year. We ate in both the hotel restaurant and cafe (unusual for us) and were pleased by the quality and price. Would recommend to friends.

I have used this hotel on 4 different occassions all on buisness and all because of its location to the company I work for,it is well located for the main Tokyo train station a very sghort taxi ride from the station,it has a subway station maybe 500 mts away also.The hotel is typoical Japanese with an efficient feel to it,a good selection of breakfast options,I have never tried dinner in the hotel,good value for the business traveller.

The rooms here are very spacious compared to most in Tokyo. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. The subway line is only 1 block away and a cheap way to get to anywhere in Tokyo. We elected to take the bus from the airport so as not to have luggage on the subway. The bus is only 3100 JPY (or $25 USD) and takes about 90 minutes with no transfers so is the easiest and cheapest way to get there. You can buy your tickets at the bus counter right outside of customs and baggage claim before exiting the airport. The breakfast at the open restaurant in the lobby was simple and inexpensive (only $8 USD) and was a nice start to the day. I think the room was a little pricey, but it was a holiday which explains the increase. All in all I would recommend this hotel as long as you are ok taking transportation to most sites....Tokyo Tower was within walking distance, and Ginzu was a far walk...everything else you would need to get a taxi or take the subway. A taxi was about 1100 JPY (or $9USD) to Rappongi Hills.

Stayed for 10 days in July 2014. Wonderful place, Well connected to all metros. Very near to world trade centre and tokyo tower. Its a value for money Hotel. Hotel is clean, food is ok. Private Guest lounge is really nice

Tucked away in what seems to be a commercial (as opposed to tourist) area, the hotel is close to a number of metro lines as well as a small bar/restaurant souk ¬100m away. In house dining options are limited (although the Italian is quite good), and the staff relentlessly helpful and polite. Concierge seemed a little uninformed regarding external information - most questions were met with "aah, is difficult", and recommended restaurants based on price "is more expensive so it must be better", kind of thing. Local restaurants have only limited english it seemed, but foreigners were welcome.Rooms are tiny (although this is pretty standard in Tokyo), but spotlessly clean. The guest lounge offers only self serve tea/coffee/water, with some drinks available in both the lobby cafe and restaurant.You are 10-15 minutes on the metro from (depending on direction), central Tokyo, Akihabara, Shibuya, Harajuku & Shinjuku, so very well located for all major tourist sights.In all, recommended as a base to explore

I stayed one night in this very nice, centrally located hotel in a clean, compact room with great city views and a comfy bed. I also had access to a private guest lounge, as well as a spacious restaurant/reception and experienced good service. Very good.

The Celestine is well located close to the monorail from Haneda, it's as you would expect a well run hotel, rooms small but normal size for a Tokyo Hotel, clean and well equipped rooms, the iron board came in handy to resolve the usual creased clothing follow a long haul.The bar is open plan and ok for meeting up, staff very helpful and food is good.

I stayed in Celestine during November 2014 for 4 nights. I'm a returning guest as I had such a good experience with the hotel during my last stay. Interestingly, the guest relations officer who served me upon check-in remembered me and greeted warmly upon my arrival! Mind you, my last stay with Celestine was about 1 year ago! Still it was the little touch like this that warmed my heart. If you're planning a stay at the Celestine, it's recommended that you make your reservations early. I understand that the hotel is only on a couple of floors. So rooms get snapped up really quickly. I stayed in the superior double room which was perfect for me. It wasn't small and it had all that I needed there. I loved especially that the wireless internet was free, high speed and smooth. The breakfast buffet in the morning serves up a good quality spread which I believe cater to international travelers well. In terms of convenience, you get Mita station about 5 mins away from the hotel, Tamachi station around 7 to 10mins walk, and if you need your necessities, no problem, there's a convenience store that's just 5 mins walk away. I do however wish the hotel had more restaurants around its vicinity or at least provide a good free flow of mineral water bottles in the room (in my case, you need to go to the convenience store to buy). Having said all that, if you need to quiet stay in a hotel that feels like home, that will offer you good quality service, experience but most of all a good quality sleep, Celestine is it!

Located a short walk from the Mita station, Celestine offers surprisingly large rooms by Tokyo standards and extra amenities such as a cafe on the 14th floor for coffee and tea that is open 24 hours with a quiet outdoor seating area. The breakfast buffet has all the staples that would make any western traveler satisfied. Picking hotels in Tokyo is difficult due to exorbitant pricing, hard beds, and small rooms, but the Celestine exceeded my expectations.

Stayed for 7 nights during November 2014. I think the hotel was a great choice in terms of location and overall price-quality ratio. The area where the hotel is located is not necessarily a very touristic area but it benefits from some amazing options of transportation. Both metro and JR station are within close reach and the hotel is 5-10 minutes taxi ride from Shinagawa train station or 5 min taxi ride from Haneda monorail station giving easy access to both NRT and HND airports. Nearby the hotel there is a very interesting area (small alleys) with loads of eateries and izakaya bars where you can watch every evening the salary men drinking themselves dead. :))Also, do not miss Zojoji temple nearby with mighty Tokyo tower behind it. The hotel itself is very cosy though you can tell from the furniture that it is not brand new, but still very clean and functional with good sound proofing. The standard room can be a bit on the small size but in case you need a roomier space they have other room options for higher prices. As we stayed on the 17th floor, the view was amazing and the natural light very pleasant. What a surprise we had on our 2nd morning when we woke up to very clear views of Mount Fuji! Highly recommended when in Tokyo.

Stayed in May, 2014. Hotel is very good located - close to the Tokyo subway stations and JR line. Tokyo Tower is just around the corner. Imperial palace is in walking (quite a long one though) distance from the hotel. Rooms a specious and comfortable, the view from the top floors is quite interesting but not the best you can get in Tokyo. From the facilities point of view hotel is very standard to Japan, no wows or surprises. Staff is helpful and polite. It's a business area around the hotel with very little of tourist attraction aside of the Tokyo Tower. In general, considering, the price level the hotel is very nice option to stay.

It was our first time to stay at this hotel and liked it very much. If you want to visit very center of Tokyo like Shibuya or Shinjuku, you can take subways. If you want to visit Roppongi and if you like walking, you can walk to get there. Still, it is quiet around the hotel. We stayed in Superia Double room with city view. The room was clean and no annoying sound. They have 24 hours-open-lounge on 14th floor. We can read books there and have coffee and tea. To see Tokyo, you don't have to drive a car, you should take train, subway or bus. Moving around Tokyo with a car is not really good because of busy traffic and car parking. But for people who come from other prefectures by a car, like us, it is very good that the hotel has car parking. It is only 1500 yen per night. Hotel staff were also nice. They seem like they enjoy their work.This is not expensive hotel but very comfortable to stay. When we stay in Tokyo, we like to stay this hotel.

I am not sure the positioning of this hotel, but we felt very comfortable and enjoyed the stay. Amenity supplies of good brand products. Clean room and bathroom. Good view...as a matter of fact, there is inner garden but all rooms are facing outside of the building, thus depends on the direction you can enjoy different view. Our rooms facing west, should be able to see Tokyo Tower, but two tall buildings blocked the view. Perhaps request the room facing north may give better view. There's a kind of executive lounge on the 14th floor with coffee & tee. Price is reasonable and access from Hamamatsucho Station of Monorail which serves Tokyo's Haneda Airport is nearby. JR Train Station, Tamachi, is walking distance, and Airport Limousine Bus makes a stop here. The name, Celestin, is probably not well known, but I recommend this hotel.

I stayed at the Celestine for four nights during a recent business trip, and had nothing but positive experiences.The location of this hotel is excellent, less than one block from the Tokyo metro in a relatively quiet (for Tokyo) part of the city, but convenient either by metro or walking to major business centers, the International Forum, and the Ginza.There is a direct bus service (which takes about 2 hours) from Narita Airport; however, if you can manage to fly in and out of Haneda, it is only about 25-30 minutes from the hotel (perhaps a little longer in heavy traffic).The rooms are on the small side, but probably the best-equipped that I have ever experienced, even in Asia, where excellent hotels are fairly commonplace.The food selections in the hotel are varied, reasonably priced for a hotel, and of very good quality; and there are also a number of good restaurants within three blocks offering varied cuisines from Asian to Italian. There are also a number of coffee bars nearby.The service was friendly, attentive, and professional. This hotel will definitely be on my short list for my next visit to Tokyo.

We stayed here early November there was four of us with two separate rooms. Hotel was kind enough to ensure that both rooms were next to eachother which made life easy. All the staff were soooo lovely. There's a little garden and lounge area on the 14th floor. Was perfect for relaxing. Bar was not overly priced in hotel and you receive a discount when presenting your hotel key which was handy!! The hotel in itself I would definitely rate 10/10, situation wise however for travellers it was a bit sucky. Extremely close the the Mita subway and a small walk to the tamachi jr line but no amazing food choices around if your not too much into seafood. If your not wanting to be in an overly crowed area and slightly away from the hussle and bussle. But close enough for some Starbucks and the yamanote line then this is perfect!!!!

Stay Oct 30 - Nov 3. This was a great location for us. My first visit. M y wife grew up in Tokyo.. and the location met both of our needs. For me to see a lot. Her to get errands done. 3 stations close by... plenty of eats in the area. Rooms are small - but was expected. Okay for two. Nicely appointed, very clean. The 14th floor court yard and guest area was a great plus, as we like sit on lanai in the mornings. Very good service. Primarily a business hotel, but no disappointments. Good price ( dollar was strong ) . I highly recommend.

I choose this Hotel because I was attaining a fair 2 blocks away.The hotel is very well located, close to restaurants and to public transports.The rooms are good, they offer free Wi-fi and the services in general are good. The breakfast was very good as well.The staff is very kind and speak good english.If one looks for a reasonably priced 4 star hotel in Shiba neighbourhood, I believe the Celestine is an excellent option.

We stayed here for 2 nights and was quite surprised how "tight" the room seemed as compared to the photo on the website. Our room was at the 15th floor (1554), not much of a view. You would need your card key to access the elevator from the ground floor. The bathroom amenities were comparable to a more expensive hotel we stayed in, except for that large wooden box where the items were kept. The box was quite large for the space on the counter of the bathroom sink. I had to rearrange it so I could put my personal stuff. The toilet and shower room was quite tight. So if you are inside, you would have to move towards the toilet just to close the door. The hotel is very near a train station (Mita Station exit A8), about 5 minutes walk, where we actually walked to get to exit A4 which led to the JR lines in Tamachi station. There is a nearby Lawson convenience store. We didn't notice much around the vicinity, mostly office buildings. Cleanliness-wise, i would have to say they could do much better. i noticed some hairs still sticking on the bathroom walls on our first night, even before we used the shower. The bathtub drain easily clogged, causing water to pool inside the tub while taking a shower. The bed was quite big for two people. Overall the hotel was okay. Front desk staff were courteous and pleasant.

Stayed here for 4 nights on a business trip. The location is quite good, not far from the train and metro. There are also quite a lot of bars and restaurants on the streets behind the hotel, I just wished I'd had more time to sample them :)The room I had was quite small but very well appointed. I've never stayed anywhere else where they provided so many things, I could have left almost all my toiletries at home! If you have to pay separately for breakfast then I wouldn't bother as it isn't very good and would just go to the coffee shop round the corner instead.

PROS- Check-in and check-out: Fast efficient and friendly- General cleanness; just perfect, I don´t have a single thing to emphasize that was bad.- Amenities in the toilet: Complimentary items available, everything that you could need and you may forgot to bring.- Towels in the bathroom: very reasonable size, not huge but big enough.- Shower water temperature: constant and efficient- Air conditioner in the bedroom: perfect, easy ti setup and silent- Bedroom soundproofing: In general the hotel is very quite, in my 4 nights stay I never had problems about noise.- Restaurants and bars: On 14th floor is lounge with free drinks and biscuits to the guests, have also a open sky garden, it´s a pleasant place to socialize with some other guests, or just enjoy some free time- Internet available: Fast and free- Location: There´s a few attractions around, such as Tokyo tower, Zojoji Temple. If you like to walk you can go even futher, I went to Ginza walking, and enjoying some sightseeing and some attraction I found here on Tripadvisor. Also is a quite location, not too much noise and traffic around. - Transports/ taxi cost: From Haneda airport by taxi is around 5000JPY to 6500JPY, depends the traffic. To Tokyo Big sight (exhibition center) around 3500JPY. Ginza around 1500JPY. To Narita airport, don´t use the taxi is too expensive, becasue is out of the city. The best way is to take the Shuttle bus, also available from Haneda, prices are around 3800JPY. But if you have a early flight in Narita, take a taxi to T-CAT( Tokyo city air terminal) and there you can get a bus shuttle. From Celestine to T-CAT is aroun 3000JPY. The staff at the reception will help about transport, they have time tables and estimated taxi prices. Also, not far hotel you have public transportation.- Decoration and room size: small room, but decent with everything you may need.- Service/staff: very friendly and good english speakers at the reception.- Breakfast: western and Japonse, quite good.- Price value: very reasonable for what you get.CONSRestaurants and bars: The restaurant to me is a little too posh. DO I WILL RETURN?Yes, for sureTAXI COST FROM/TO AIRPORT:From Haneda airport by taxi is around 5000JPY to 6500JPY, depends the traffic. To Tokyo Big sight (exhibition center) around 3500JPY. Ginza around 1500JPY. To Narita airport, don´t use the taxi is too expensive, becasue is out of the city. The best way is to take the Shuttle bus, also available from Haneda, prices are around 3800JPY. But if you have a early flight in Narita, take a taxi to T-CAT( Tokyo city air terminal) and there you can get a bus shuttle. From Celestine to T-CAT is aroun 3000JPY.

The hotel Celestine is a little disorienting at first. The lobby is on the ground floor, as are the restaurants and the rooms are on floors 11-14. My room was in the small side but well appointed, with a 2 seats couch, coffee table, queen size bed and little desk. The wardrobe can only accommodate a couple of suits and shirts and when my luggage was against the wall, i did not have much more than 2 feet clearance to the bed. Despite its size, I found the room well thought of, with great little upgrade such as a humidifier/ ionizer which did wonders for jet lag. The restaurants are both good in term of variety and execution with both local and western fare. The hotel is about 200 yards from the nearest metro station (3 stops from the fish market and 2 from Ginza) which made it a perfect location for me. The back alleys behind the metro station features 50 restaurants which made dinner options really easy. The hotel is quiet and clean and I found it very good quality for money.

We stayed 4 nights in October. Used the limosinebus from Narita airport which was easy and fast. Good rooms and quiet location. the public lounge area is great and very nice protected courtyards to enjoy the free coffee/tea at anytime. Would be very happy to stay there again

I've stayed at the Celestine twice because it is convenient to my company's headquarters, but it is a good choice even if not traveling on business. As several others have mentioned, you probably want to book the double deluxe room - it's reasonable compared to other hotels in Tokyo and while not as large as US hotels, is roomy by Japanese standards. It has two double beds, a small sofa, work desk, and mini bar. The lobby is very nice, the rooms are clean, and WiFi is free. The rooms are very quiet - I never hear any city noise or noise from other rooms. There is a nice lounge on the 14th floor. I like to workout every day, and in some hotels I am able to do some exercises in the room, but there really isn't enough room here. However, the hotel will provide a running map, which is a fairly short route around Shiba Park (walking the route took me 30 minutes).The hotel is very close to several subway stations and train station, with easy access to almost any area of Tokyo. As mentioned Shiba Park is nearby, and there you will find Zojoji Temple - one of the larger temples in Tokyo. Behind the Park is Tokyo Tower, which offers a great view of the city from the second "Special Observation" deck.I also walked to the Imperial Palace and the Ginza - it's a pretty straight shot down Hibiya Dori. However, I am an avid walker and most people would want to take the subway to the Palace and Ginza. In short, convenient, clean, modern, quiet and a good value.

I wrote about this hotel a couple of years ago and then stayed there again recently with my wife. It is definitely a good place to stay, we had the double deluxe room, from check in until departure I only enjoyed great customer service. The rooms are immaculate, the double deluxe was adequate and the restaurant in the morning was also good. Overall really efficient and modern hotel with free internet and non smoking, this is a gem when in Tokyo close to subway and about 10 minute walk to JR Tamachi.

ネットの写真で決めて行きましたが、良かったです。値段もビジネスホテルとして使うのに良いかと思いました。部屋の広さも十分ありましたし、スタッフはいませんがよくあるエグゼクティブラウンジのようなスペースもあり、快適でした。スタッフの方々も親切で丁寧ですし、館内も綺麗です。またそちらの方でビジネスの用事があれば伺いたいと思いました。I decided to reserve this hotel with the pictures of internet site, and the real things were also good. And the price was also ok for business trip. The room was not too small not too big, it was ok for Japanese. Little bit bigger than the usual size of single room in Japan. I liked it. They have a room to drink coffee for free like "exective launge" without hotel staff so I could relax some times. If I have chance to visit aroud there with business, I will use here again.

I chose this hotel largely because the entire hotel is non-smoking which is very rare in Japan. I booked a deluxe double which is a level above "superior double" and bigger. The room size is decent for Tokyo. Room is very clean with all necessary amenities despite the age of the hotel. Great customer service upon arrival - prompt assistance with luggage, and smooth check-in. The partial view of the Rainbow Bridge from the room was great, once you get over the office building right in front of the window. I used the free lounge on the 14th floor frequently (open 24 hours) because there was a nice espresso machine. It'd be great if English newspapers and magazines can be provided in the lounge in addition to the Japanese ones, since this is an international business hotel visited by a lot of foreigners. The lounge came with a cozy outdoors terrace area and the only complaint I have is the virtual separation of smoking and non smoking areas on opposite ends of the lounge which really didn't work when there was more than one person smoking. Overall, a nice hotel for the price and I would come back again.

I agree with girasol - book a big room - Tokyo has a space problem - but it is clean and silent - u get a good nights sleep in very comfortable beds - a pleasure after some hotels I stayed at in cornwall and kerala - well connected to public transport and has two excellent alleys to the right and the left , a little ways up full of authentic japenese cuisine and bars - and a mighty shrine - the staff at the hotel are polite , friendly , very helpful - very peaceful coffee lounge - I enjoyed my stay

I stayed at Celestine several times due to proximity to my office. Its an ok business hotel with a restaurant/ cafe on the 1st floor and a coffee lounge for guests on the 4th floor. Breakfast is nice with Western and Japanese choices.Room sizes vary - so make sure you book a big room otherwise you might end up in a closed on the lower floors. Free wifi is provided - highspeed wifi for a fee.What's missing is a gym but you can go running to a nearby park. Bus shuttle to both airports are available but be aware that the bus to Haneda takes you 1.5h whereas with a taxi only 20 min.

I stayed at the Celestine in August 2014 while on a business trip. This was the second time to stay at this hotel, after staying there in December 2008.
